Valencia put a great fight but ultimately fell in the third place game of the Oaks Christian tournament.
Lonnie Jackson scored 24 points but it wasnt enough in a 66-58 overtime setback against Sacramento.
The Vikings (8
continuation:
-5) trailed by as many as 10 points in the first half, but rallied to tie the game at 44-44 with 2:45 left in regulation.
Sacramento then went on a 9-0 run to open up a six-point lead and never looked back.
Jackson was held scoreless in the second half, but still managed to hit four 3-pointers.
He finished with 12 rebounds and five assists.
Jalen Harris led Valencia with 20 points.
Sacramento will face off against San Diego in the semifinals of the tournament.

input:
The United Nations has restarted its process for setting rules on "responsible state behaviour in cyberspace" with two separate forums, and Australia intends to continue being a key player.
On Friday, Australia's Ambassador for Cyber Affairs Dr Tobias Feakin
continuation:
announced that the Australian government had been invited to attend the first forum, which will be held in Geneva later this month.
The second forum will be hosted by the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in New York, and will take place in October.
Dr Feakin said it was important for Australia to play an active role at both forums.
"Cybersecurity is one of our most important national security issues," he said.
"We're very pleased that we've been invited to participate in these forums."
Australia's cyber-security minister, Paul Fletcher, said the country was committed to working with the international community to ensure that all countries were able to protect their citizens from online threats.
"It is critical that all countries have access to the tools they need to protect their citizens," Mr Fletcher said in a statement.
"We are proud to be part of this initiative and look forward to contributing to the discussion."
In March, Australia became the first country to sign up to the UN Global Compact on Responsible State Behaviour in Cyberspace, which aims to create a global framework for responsible state behaviour in cyberspace.
Under the agreement, states commit to upholding human
translation:
The United Nations has restarted the process to set rules for the "responsible conduct of states in cyberspace" through two separate forums, and Australia will continue to play a key role.
On Friday, Australia's special envoy for cybersecurity Tobias Feakin announced that the Australian government has been invited to attend the first forum in Geneva later this month.
The second forum will be hosted by the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) in New York and will be held in October.
Dr Feakin said it was important Australia played an active role in both forums.
"Cybersecurity is one of the most important national security issues," he said.
We are very pleased to have been invited to participate in these forums.
Australia's Cybersecurity Minister Paul Fletcher said he was committed to working with the international community to ensure all countries protect their citizens from online threats.
"It is important that all countries have access to the tools they need to protect their citizens," Fletcher said in his statement.
We are proud to be part of this effort and look forward to contributing to the conversation.
In March, Australia became the first country to sign the United Nations Global Compact on Responsible State Behavior in Cyberspace, which aims to create a global framework for the responsible conduct of States in cyberspace. .
Under this agreement, each country commits to protecting human rights.

input:
During a day of events designed to raise the profile of his agenda for education, President Clinton last week urged parents and teachers to embrace a "whole ethic'' of lifelong learning to insure the nation's continued economic productivity.
"The fact of the
continuation:
matter is that if we don't keep up with the pace of change in our economy,'' he said, ''we will not be able to compete.''
In a speech at the National Press Club on Thursday, Mr. Clinton also called for an overhaul of America's high-school system, which he said was failing to prepare young people for the 21st-century job market.
"We need to make sure that every kid who wants to go to college can,'' he said.
Mr. Clinton has made education a central theme of his second term. He has proposed a $1.5 trillion increase in federal spending over the next decade on K-12 schools, higher education and community colleges.
His plan calls for raising the federal minimum wage from its current level of $7.25 an hour to $9.50 an hour by 2010. The proposal would also create a national paid family leave program and require all employers with 50 or more workers to offer 12 weeks of paid parental leave.
Mr. Clinton's proposals have been met with strong opposition from some Republicans, who argue that they are too expensive and could drive up the cost of consumer goods and services.
Mr. Clinton's remarks came during a daylong series of events

At an event aimed at raising awareness of his education policy last week, President Clinton urged parents and teachers to embrace a "holistic ethic" of lifelong learning to ensure the nation's continued economic productivity. I called on you to accept it.
"The reality is that if we don't keep up with the pace of change in the economy, we won't be able to compete," he said.
Speaking at the National Press Club on Thursday, Clinton also called for an overhaul of America's secondary education system, saying young people are not being prepared for the 21st century job market.
"We need to make sure that all kids who want to go to college can go to college," he says.

Mr. Clinton's proposal faces strong opposition from some Republicans who say it is too expensive and could lead to higher prices for consumer goods and services.
Clinton's remarks came amid a series of events over the course of a day.

Following the Australian government citing a lack of separation of edge and core in 5G, Huawei has demonstrated what it says is full isolation of each network component in New Zealand on a trial network with Spark.
Huawei has revealed a 5G trial network
continuation:
in New Zealand that it claims to be fully isolated from the rest of the network.
The company's chief technology officer (CTO) Ren Zhengfei made the claim during a keynote speech at the Mobile World Congress (MWC) in Barcelona, Spain on Tuesday.
"We have been working on this for more than two years," he said. "I can say we are 100 per cent isolated from the rest of the network."
Zhengfei also claimed that the company's 5G base stations will be able to operate in extreme weather conditions, such as rain, snow or hail.

, and Texas Instrumentshave been in use for some time, but ARMs presence has only increased over the last few years.

ARM CEO Simon Segars said during a keynote address at the Mobile World Congress (MWC) in Barcelona, Spain that the company now has more than 100 licensees of its intellectual property (IP). In addition, he noted that the number of Android-based products using ARMs technology continues to grow.

Weve seen a lot of growth in the last 12 months, Segars said. I think its safe to say that we have more than 100 licensees of our intellectual property today, and that number is growing every single day.

translation:
Yesterday afternoon, IP processor supplier ARM announced that its processor IP is finding its way into a growing number of mobile devices. Of course, ARM-based devices have been around for some time, including processors from companies like Apple, Marvell, MediaTek, Nvidia, Qualcomm, Samsung, and Texas Instruments, but ARM's presence has only grown in the last few years.

Simon Segers, CEO of ARM, said in his keynote address at Mobile World Congress (MWC) in Barcelona, Spain that the company currently owns more than 100 intellectual property (IP) companies. He said he has a licensee. Additionally, he pointed out that the number of Android-based products using ARM technology continues to grow.

"We've seen significant growth over the last 12 months," he says Seegars. Currently, there are over 100 licensees of our intellectual property, and it is no exaggeration to say that the number is increasing every day.

Segers also noted that ARM's licensing revenue has doubled since 2012, with the company's licensing business now accounting for about 20% of its overall revenue. He added that the company's licensing business is expected to reach $3 billion this year, up from $1.5 billion in 2013.

This is an important part of our business, Segers said.

input:
Nigeria remains deeply divided over a ban imposed last month on television stations showing so-called "miracles".
Programmes showing miracles have disappeared from screens in compliance with an edict from the Nigeria's National Broadcasting Commission, which took effect from
continuation:
January 1.
The commission said it had received complaints from viewers who were offended by such programmes.
But critics say the move is part of a wider campaign to stifle freedom of expression in Africa's most populous nation.
"This is a government that has no respect for the rule of law," said Oby Ezekwesili, a former minister of education and current vice-president of the opposition Peoples Democratic Party (PDP).
Ezekwesili was one of the signatories of a letter to President Muhammadu Buhari earlier this year, urging him to reverse the ban.
"We are living in a country where you can be arrested for criticising the government," she told the Thomson Reuters Foundation by phone from Lagos.
"It is very clear that they don't want to hear anything negative about them."
Buhari's spokesman, Garba Shehu, did not immediately respond to requests for comment.
In a statement on its website, the NCC said the ban was aimed at promoting religious tolerance and unity.
"The Commission wishes to state categorically that it does not intend to restrict any form of free speech or expression as enshrined in our constitution," it said.
"
translation:
Nigeria remains deeply divided over last month's ban on television stations broadcasting so-called "miracles."
In accordance with the National Broadcasting Commission of Nigeria's decree that came into effect on January 1, the program showing miracles has been removed from the screens.
The commission said it had received complaints from viewers who were offended by such programs.
But critics say the move is part of a broader campaign to suppress freedom of expression in Africa's most populous country.
This government has no respect for the rule of law, said Obi Ezekwesili, a former education minister and current deputy leader of the opposition Peoples Democratic Party (PDP).
Ezekwesili was among those who signed a letter to President Muhammadu Buhari earlier this year calling for the ban to be lifted.
We live in a country where you can be arrested if you criticize the government, she told the Thomson Reuters Foundation by phone from Lagos.
"It's clear they don't want to hear anything negative about themselves."
Mr Buhari's spokesman Garba Shehu did not respond to requests for comment.
The NCC said in a statement on its website that the ban aims to promote religious tolerance and unity.
The committee wishes to assure you that it does not intend to limit any constitutional freedom of speech or expression, it said.

input:
An Illinois man who purchased a handgun and more than 100 rounds of ammunition in Marion, Iowa, was sentenced to more than three years in prison yesterday in federal court in Cedar Rapids.
Montarrance Wilson, age 27, from Chicago, Illinois,
continuation:
pleaded guilty to one count of unlawful possession of a firearm by a convicted felon. According to the plea agreement, Wilson admitted that he possessed an unregistered Smith & Wesson M&P Shield 9mm semiautomatic pistol on July 1, 2016, at his home in Chicago. Wilson also admitted that he had more than 100 rounds of.40-caliber ammunition in his vehicle when he was pulled over for speeding on Interstate 80 in Marion, Iowa, on June 28, 2016.
U.S. District Judge Robert E. Chambers imposed a sentence of 18 months imprisonment followed by three years supervised release. The judge also ordered Wilson to pay a $1,000 fine.
Assistant U.S. Attorney John R. Hulshof prosecuted the case.
This case is part of Project Safe Neighborhoods (PSN), a program bringing together all levels of law enforcement and the communities they serve to reduce violent crime and make our neighborhoods safer for everyone. In fiscal year 2017, PSN involved more than 800 law enforcement agencies in 37 states and Washington, D.C., with more than 3,000 arrests.
The Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) investigated this case.
translation:
An Illinois man who purchased a handgun and more than 100 rounds of ammunition in Marion, Iowa, was sentenced yesterday in federal court in Cedar Rapids to more than three years in prison.

Montarance Wilson, 27, of Chicago, Illinois, pleaded guilty to one count of unlawful possession of a firearm by a convicted felon. According to the plea agreement, Wilson admitted to possessing an unregistered Smith & Wesson M&P Shield 9mm semi-automatic handgun at his Chicago home on July 1, 2016. Wilson also admitted to having more than 100 rounds of .40 caliber ammunition in his vehicle when he was stopped for speeding on Interstate 80 in Marion, Iowa on June 28, 2016.

U.S. District Judge Robert E. Chambers sentenced Wilson to 18 months in prison, followed by three years of supervised release. The judge also ordered Wilson to pay a $1,000 fine.

Assistant U.S. Attorney John R. Halshoff prosecuted the case.
This case is part of Project Safe Neighborhoods (PSN), a program that brings together law enforcement agencies at all levels and their jurisdictions to reduce violent crime and make communities safer for everyone. In fiscal year 2017, PSN deployed more than 800 law enforcement agencies across 37 states and Washington, D.C., making more than 3,000 arrests.
This case was investigated by the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF).

input:
Education or Indoctrination in Texas?
The news from the nation's most influential state board of education is another reminder of the difficulty of creating a curriculum that passes muster with all stakeholders. In early March, the Texas board released its social studies standards
continuation:
for the 2020-21 school year. The standards are based on the Common Core State Standards (CCSS) developed by the U.S. Department of Education.
The CCSS were adopted by the states in 2010 and have been updated every two years since then to reflect changes in federal policy and state law. For instance, in 2018, the Trump administration withdrew federal funding for states that did not adopt the Common Core standards.
Texas was one of those states that opted out of the Common Core, but it has continued to use them as a framework for its social studies curriculum. As a result, many teachers and parents are concerned about how the standards will be implemented in their classrooms.
In response to these concerns, Gov. Greg Abbott recently signed into law House Bill 3, which prohibits local governments from requiring students to take any foreign language other than English as a second language (ESL). It also prohibits local governments from requiring students to take any foreign language other than English as a first language (EFL), including Spanish, Mandarin, Cantonese, Korean, and Tagalog. HB 3 does not apply to charter schools, public universities, or private institutions of higher education.
"This bill is an important step toward ensuring that Texans
translation:
Texas education or indoctrination?
The news from the most powerful state education agency in the country is yet another reminder of the difficulty of creating a curriculum that is acceptable to all stakeholders. In early March, the Texas State Board of Education released social studies standards for the 2020-21 school year. The standards are based on the Common Core State Standards (CCSS) developed by the U.S. Department of Education.
The CCSS was adopted by states in 2010 and has been updated every two years since then to reflect changes in federal and state policy. For example, in 2018, the Trump administration cut off federal funding to states that had not adopted Common Core standards.
Texas was one of the states that abandoned Common Core but continued to use it as the basis of its social studies curriculum. As a result, many teachers and parents are concerned about how the standards will be implemented in the classroom.
In response to these concerns, Governor Greg Abbott recently signed House Bill 3, which prohibits local governments from requiring students to learn a foreign language other than English as a Second Language (ESL). It also prohibits local governments from requiring students to study foreign languages other than English as a First Language (EFL), such as Spanish, Mandarin, Cantonese, Korean, and Tagalog. HB 3 does not apply to charter schools, public universities, or private institutions of higher education.
This bill is an important step toward keeping Texans safe.

input:
Should it be business as usual and a comfortable position of passivity, or should it answer, with action, the Palestinian call for solidarity and support?
At their base, these are the questions fuelling recent debates about the department of international relations'
continuation:
(DIR) role in Palestine.
The DIR has been accused by some of being too pro-Israel, while others have questioned its commitment to democracy and human rights.
But what is clear is that the DIR has an important role to play in promoting peace and stability in the Middle East and beyond.
In this context, it is important to look back at the DIR's history and consider how it has evolved over the last 50 years.

input:
A certain politician recently lost their very high-profile, very powerful job. While this was not a surprise to other people, they say it was a surprise to them.
They also say that what happened was unfair and uncalled for.
Despite
continuation:
the fact that they had done nothing wrong, they were fired from their position as a result of the actions of someone else.
This is not the first time such an incident has occurred.
In the past, politicians have been fired from their positions for similar reasons.
For example, former President George W. Bushs Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice was fired from her position after she refused to endorse his reelection bid in 2004.
Former President Barack Obamas Attorney General Eric Holder was also fired from his position after he refused to defend the Affordable Care Act (Obamacare) in front of the U.S. Supreme Court in 2013.

continuation:
good news for Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) and former Secretary of Housing and Urban Development Julin Castro (D).

But there are other signs that the race is tightening. A new NBC News/Wall Street Journal poll released on Tuesday found Sanders leading Donald Trump among likely Michigan voters by just one point, 49 percent to 48 percent. Thats a significant drop from last month, when Sanders was ahead by six points.

Sanderss lead comes despite the fact that he hasnt held a public event in Michigan since September. The Vermont senator has spent much of the campaign focused on his home state of New Hampshire, where polls show him trailing both Hillary Clinton and Jeb Bush.

Meanwhile, Trumps support among Michigan voters has remained steady over the past few months. He remains popular with white working-class voters, who make up more than two-thirds of the states electorate. And he still enjoys strong support among African-Americans, who account for nearly half of the states Democratic primary voters.

Trumps support among white working-class voters is particularly noteworthy because it suggests that he may have difficulty reaching out to black voters

input:
The seven-day plan for getting your home and yard ready for summer.
On the HouseMitch KuffaGuest columnist FHA and private home housing inspector and licensed builder Mitchell Kuffa, of St. Clair, Wednesday April 14,
continuation:
2021, talks about how to get your home and yard ready for summer. (Photo: Robert Scheer/IndyStar)Buy Photo
I'm a real estate agent who specializes in single-family homes. I've been doing this for more than 30 years, and I can tell you that it's never been more important to make sure your house is ready for summer.
If you don't take care of these things now, you'll end up having to spend a lot of money on repairs later down the road.
Here are some things you need to do before the weather gets too hot.
1. Clean out the gutters and downspouts.
Gutters and downspouts should be cleaned out at least once a year. If they're clogged with leaves or other debris, you could have a problem with water seeping through the roof into your home.
2. Remove all debris from around your home.
Debris such as tree limbs and branches can cause damage to your siding if they're not properly removed. It's also a good idea to remove any large rocks or boulders that might fall onto your roof.
3. Make sure your windows are clean and free of dirt and grime
translation:
A 7-day plan to prepare your home and garden for summer.
On HouseMitch KuffaGuest on Wednesday, April 14, 2021, St. Clair FHA columnist, private home inspector, and licensed builder Mitchell Kuffa talks about how to prepare your home and yard for summer. (Photo: Robert Scheer/IndyStar)Buy Photo
I am a real estate agent specializing in private housing. I've been doing this job for over 30 years, and I can tell you it's more important than ever to have your home ready for summer.
If you don't take care of these things now, you could end up spending a lot of money on renovations in the future.
Here are some things to do before it gets too hot.
1. Clean your gutters and downspouts.
Gutters and downspouts should be cleaned at least once a year. If it's clogged with leaves and other debris, you can have problems with water seeping into your home through your roof.
2. Remove all trash around the house.
Debris such as tree limbs and branches can damage your siding if not removed properly. It is also a good idea to remove any large rocks or stones that may fall onto your roof.
3. Make sure the windows are clean and free of dirt and grime.

input:
Former Indian skipper and national women's team coach Divya Singh is impressed with the talent exhibited by country's top 18 women prospects currently receiving training at the basketball development program.
NAGPUR: Former Indian skipper and national women's team coach
continuation:
Divya Singh has expressed her satisfaction over the quality of the players who are being groomed for the upcoming Tokyo Olympics, which will be held from July 23 to August 8 this year.
Divya said that she was very happy to see so many talented girls coming up in the last few years. "I have seen a lot of young girls coming up in the last three-four years and I am happy to see them doing well. It shows that they are getting the right kind of coaching and support," she told TOI.
The former India captain also spoke about the role played by the National Sports Development Authority (NSDA) in grooming these talents.
"The NSDA has done a good job in grooming these young girls. They are getting proper exposure and training under the guidance of some of the best coaches in the country," she added.
Divya, who led India to gold medals in the Asian Games and Commonwealth Games in 2006 and 2010 respectively, was recently appointed as the head coach of the Indian women's basketball team. She took charge of the position on June 1.
"I am really looking forward to working with the girls and helping them achieve their goals. I am confident that we can do well in the Olympics

The 46-year-old father-of-two was found dead at Elsternwick Park in Brighton on Saturday
continuation:

A post mortem will take place to determine the exact cause of death.

He is survived by his wife and two daughters.

Hester joined the band in 1984 and remained with them until 1997 when he left to form his own solo career.

A MULTI-MILLION pound treatment centre which aims to slash waiting times for patients at Leighton Hospital has moved closer.
Health chiefs at the South Cheshire hospital cut the first sod to mark the start of building at the site of
continuation:
the new 20 million facility, which will be built on the former A&E department and is due to open next year.
The move comes as part of a 1.5 billion investment by NHS England over the next five years to improve health services across the country.
Leightons chief operating officer, Dr Chris Hinchliffe, said: We are delighted to have reached this important milestone in the development of our new state-of-the-art multi-million pound cancer treatment centre.
This is an exciting time for us and we look forward to working with our partners to deliver a world-class facility that will provide the very best care for our patients.
Construction work is expected to last until the end of the year.
NHS Greater Manchester chief executive Andy Burnham welcomed the news.
He said: Its fantastic news that construction has started on the new Cancer Treatment Centre at Leighton Hospital.
With more than 2,000 people being treated for cancer every year in Greater Manchester, its great to see this project progressing so well.
I would like to thank everyone involved for their hard work and dedication

input:
Hillary Rodham Clinton has chosen a Brooklyn Heights office building as the headquarters for her all-but-declared presidential campaign, according to several reports.
The former first lady, U.S. senator and secretary of state is renting space at One Pier
continuation:
repont St., which was built in 1887, The New York Times reported Friday.
A spokesman for Clinton did not immediately respond to a request for comment from The Post.
The move comes amid speculation that Clinton will run for president in 2016.
Her husband, former President Bill Clinton, launched his own White House bid in 2008 but dropped out before the Iowa caucuses.
The Clintons real estate holdings have been scrutinized by federal investigators probing Hillary Clintons use of a private email server during her time as secretary of state.
Clintons spokeswoman, Jen Psaki, said earlier this month that the Clintons have no plans to make any decisions about their future until after the November election.
But she added: We are focused on our work right now, and we look forward to continuing to serve the American people in the months and years ahead.
One source close to the Clintons told The Post last week that they were seriously considering running for president again.
I think its going to happen, the source said. Its just a matter of when. It could be early next year, or it could be later

input:
Friends and supporters of a Tamil family, who are facing deportation, have marched through the rain to Peter Dutton's Brisbane office.
Singing The Seekers hit I am, you are, we are Australian, the protesters first rallied at a crowd
continuation:
-funding page set up for the family.
The campaign has so far raised more than $30,000, which will be used to help pay for their legal fees if they are sent back to Sri Lanka, where they were born.
Mr Dutton said on Tuesday that he had "no intention" of deporting the family.
He told Sky News: "I don't think it's appropriate to send them back to Sri Lanka."
But his comments drew criticism from Labor MP Kristina Keneally, who accused him of being "out of touch with reality".
"This is not just about one family, this is about thousands of families in Australia," she told reporters outside Mr Dutton's office.
"We've got a Prime Minister who is out of touch with reality when it comes to refugees and asylum seekers.
"It's time for him to get off his high horse and start acting like a Prime Minister."
Ms Keneally said she was "very concerned" about the family's fate.
"They have been here for over 20 years," she said.
"Their children have grown up here. Their grandchildren are going to grow up here.
"They are part of our community.

An organization representing Cardinal Mooney High School minority graduates is calling a classroom lesson purportedly aimed at recreating the experience of slavery, deeply troubling.
The Cardinal Mooney High School Minority Alumni Council has issued a statement saying that a Black History lesson subject
continuation:
ing students to a "slavery simulation" was "deeply troubling."
In a letter to the school's principal and superintendent, members of the council said they were disturbed by what they described as an "inappropriate" and "disturbing" classroom activity.
According to the letter, which was obtained by The Philadelphia Inquirer and published on its website, a teacher in the social studies department presented the class with a PowerPoint presentation titled, "How Slavery Affected African-Americans," which included photographs of enslaved people and their captors.
Students were then asked to write about how slavery affected them. One student wrote that he had never seen a photograph of his great-great-grandparents before.
"I felt like I was seeing my ancestors for the first time," the student wrote. "I couldn't help but feel a sense of dread and sadness."
Members of the minority alumni council called the lesson "deeply troubling" and said it should be removed from the curriculum.

input: It's 75 years since Trotsky, already expelled from the Soviet Communist Party and exiled, went to start a new life in Mexico. But he was hunted down in Mexico City by Stalinist assassins, as his grandson, who was living with him when he
continuation:
died, has just revealed.

In an exclusive interview with The Independent, Vladimir Ilyich Lenins great-grandson, Vladimir Ilyich Ulyanov (VILU), said: My grandfather was murdered in Mexico City on February 23rd, 1937. He was shot at point-blank range in front of my mother and two sisters. My grandmother was also killed, but she survived.

Lenin had been living in Mexico City with his second wife and their three children, including VILUs father, Mikhail Ilyich Ulyanov (MILU).

His death came just days after he had returned to Moscow from a trip to Cuba, where he had visited Fidel Castro and other leaders of the Cuban Revolution.

I think its important that people know what happened, VILU told The Independent. The truth is that my grandfather was assassinated because he stood up for workers rights and against Stalinism.

He was one of the most important figures in the history of the Soviet Union. He was the first person to be expelled from the Communist Party. He was the first person to be expelled

The attorney general said he wants to improve protections of medical service and see a more representative board manage sale proceeds.
ASHEVILLE  State Attorney General Josh Stein said Tuesday he wants to see changes in the proposed sale of Mission Health to HCA Healthcare
continuation:
, which is seeking approval from the North Carolina Board of Medicine.
Stein made the comments during an interview with The Asheville Citizen-Times.
We want to make sure that were doing everything we can to protect the interests of the patients who are going to be affected by this transaction, Stein said. Thats why I think its so important for us to look at how were going to do that.
Stein declined to comment further on the matter, citing ongoing negotiations between his office and HCA. He did not say whether his office would seek to block the deal if it goes through.
HCA has agreed to pay $2.4 billion to acquire Mission, one of the largest health care systems in the country. The deal is expected to close in the first half of 2020.
Stein said he wants to ensure that the states Medicaid program does not get hurt as a result of the deal.
Im very concerned about the impact that this transaction could have on our Medicaid system, Stein said. Its something that Ive been working very hard on
translation:
The attorney general said he wants to improve health care protections and have a more representative board control sales revenue.
Asheville Attorney General Josh Stein said Tuesday he wants to make changes to the proposed sale of Mission Health to HCA Healthcare, which is seeking approval from the North Carolina Medical Board.
Stein made the comments in an interview with the Asheville Citizen-Times.
We want to ensure that we do everything we can to protect the interests of patients affected by this transaction, Stein said. That's why I think it's so important to think about how to achieve this.
Stein declined to comment on the matter, citing ongoing discussions between his office and HCA. He did not say whether the department would try to block the deal if it were to take place.
HCA agreed to pay $2.4 billion to acquire Mission, one of the nation's largest health systems. The transaction is expected to close in the first half of 2020.
Stein said he wants to make sure the state's Medicaid program is not harmed as a result of the deal.
"I am very concerned about the impact this agreement will have on our nation's Medicaid system," Stein said. This is something I've been working hard on.

How secure is your data on WhatsApp? Well, we answer all the top questions related to your privacy on the worlds most popular messaging application.
Last year, Facebook-owned WhatsApp rolled out end-to-end encryption for more than
continuation:
1 billion users in India. This means that only the sender and receiver of a message will be able to see each others messages.
WhatsApp has been under intense scrutiny over the last few years, especially after it was revealed that the company had shared user data with Cambridge Analytica during the 2016 US presidential elections.
The social media giant has also faced criticism for not doing enough to protect user data from being accessed by third-parties.
Here are some important things you need to know about WhatsApp:
1. What is end-to-end encryption?
End-to-end encryption (or E2EE) is a method of communication that allows two or more parties to communicate securely without revealing any information about one another.
In simple terms, it prevents anyone else from reading your messages unless you choose to share them.
2. How does WhatsApp use end-to-end encryption?
WhatsApp uses end-to-end encryption to ensure that no third party can read your messages.
To enable this feature, you will have to download the latest version of the app from the Play Store or App Store.
Once you do so, you will be asked to enter your phone number
translation:
How safe is your data on WhatsApp? answers all your basic privacy questions about the world's most popular messaging app.
Last year, Facebook-owned WhatsApp introduced end-to-end encryption to its more than 1 billion users in India. This means that only the sender and recipient of a message can see each other's messages.
WhatsApp has come under intense scrutiny in recent years, particularly after it was revealed that it shared user data with Cambridge Analytica during the 2016 US presidential election.
The social media giant has also been criticized for not taking enough steps to protect user data from access by third parties.
There are some important things to know about WhatsApp.
1. What is end-to-end encryption?
End-to-end encryption (E2EE) is a communication method that allows two or more parties to communicate securely without revealing information about each other.
Simply put, no one will be able to read your messages unless you choose to share them.
2. How does WhatsApp use end-to-end encryption?
WhatsApp uses end-to-end encryption to ensure that no third party can read your messages.
To enable this feature, you must download the latest version of the app from the Play Store or App Store.
When you do this, you will be asked to enter your phone number.

input:
Chelsea stand one win away from the Premier League title after mounting an impressive comeback to beat Leicester City at the King Power Stadium.
Jose Mourinho's side needed to call on all their reserves of quality and resilience to overcome Leicester City's fiercely determined challenge which
continuation:
saw them take a 2-0 lead into half-time thanks to goals from N'Golo Kante and Alvaro Morata.
Mourinho's men, who had lost just once in the league this season prior to kick-off, came out with renewed vigour in the second period and levelled through Eden Hazard before Marcos Alonso scored a late winner.
The result means that Chelsea are now only four points behind leaders Manchester United, who have a game in hand, and will be crowned champions if they can avoid defeat against Crystal Palace at Old Trafford on Sunday.
"It was a fantastic performance," Mourinho told Sky Sports. "I'm very proud of my team. I'm very proud of my players.
"We knew it was going to be difficult. We knew we were going to have to fight for every single ball."
Leicester manager Claude Puel said: "We played well in the first half, we created some good chances but we didn't score.
"In the second half we were much better, we controlled the game and we could have scored more than two goals.
"I am really disappointed because I think we should have been three or four goals up at half-time.
translation:
Chelsea made a stunning comeback to defeat Leicester City at the King Power Stadium, but they are now just one win away from winning the Premier League.
Jose Mourinho's side needed to use all their reserves of quality and resilience to overcome Leicester City's determined challenge, with goals from N'Golo Kante and Alvaro Morata giving them a lead at half-time. They led 2-0.
Mourinho's side had lost just once in the league this season before kick-off, but they came back with renewed vigor in the second period, equalizing through Eden Hazard and then Marcos Alonso scoring the winner. Ta.
The result leaves Chelsea four points behind leaders Manchester United, with a game remaining and the champions to be crowned if they avoid defeat against Crystal Palace at Old Trafford on Sunday.
"It was a great performance," Mourinho told Sky Sports. Im very proud of my team, Im very proud of my players.
"We knew it was going to be difficult. We knew we had to fight for every ball."
Leicester manager Claude Puel said: ``We played well in the first half and created some chances, but we couldn't score.
We were much better in the second half, controlled the game and could have scored more than two goals.
"It's very disappointing because I think we should have scored three or four goals at half-time.

input: In the coming days, much of the coverage of the Chernobyl disaster in Russia is likely to focus on the 30-year anniversary and commemorations of it. The same may be said of reporting in Ukraine and Belarus, countries directly affected by the ramifications
continuation:
of the nuclear accident.

But there are other aspects of the disaster that deserve attention as well. For instance, a new report from the Institute for Science and International Security (ISIS), a think tank affiliated with the U.S. National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine, has found that the Soviet Unions nuclear weapons program was far more extensive than previously thought.

The report, titled Soviet Nuclear Weapons: A Global Perspective, finds that the Soviet Union conducted at least 1,200 nuclear tests between 1945 and 1991. In addition, ISIS estimates that the Soviet Union had about 2,000 nuclear warheads during the Cold War, which would have been enough to destroy all of Europe.

Its important to note that these figures do not include tests conducted by the United States or its allies, such as Israel, Pakistan, and North Korea. And they dont take into account tests conducted by non-nuclear states, such as India, China, Pakistan, and North Korea.

According to ISIS, the Soviet Unions nuclear weapons program was one of the largest and most sophisticated in the world. It also produced some of the most destructive weapons ever tested,
translation:

But there are other aspects of this disaster that are worth noting. For example, a new report from the Institute for Science and International Security (ISIS), a think tank under the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine, found that the Soviet nuclear weapons program was much larger than previously thought. It is important to note that these figures do not include tests conducted by the United States or its allies: Israel, Pakistan, and North Korea. They also do not take into account tests conducted by non-nuclear weapon states such as India, China, Pakistan, and North Korea.

ISIS says the Soviet nuclear weapons program was one of the largest and most complex in the world, and produced some of the most destructive weapons ever tested.

input:
The Scottish Rugby Union is poised to take a step into the unknown by buying a stake in a professional rugby club in the United States.
A bid has been made for a minority share in Old Glory DC, an expansion club based in Washington DC who
continuation:
will play their home games at RFK Stadium.
The move would be the first time that the national governing body of the sport in Scotland has invested in a US-based team.
Rugby league and American football are both popular sports in the country, but rugby union is not as well known.
Old Glory DC are currently playing in the National Premier Soccer League (NPSL) - the third tier of the US soccer pyramid - having won promotion last season.
They have already announced that they will be moving up to the top flight of the NPSL next season.
Image: The Scottish Rugby Union is poised to buy a stake in Old Glory DC
Scottish Rugby Union chief executive Mark Dodson said: "We are excited about the prospect of investing in this exciting new club and look forward to working with them to help them achieve their ambitious goals."
Dodson added: "We are always looking for ways to grow our game across the globe and we believe this investment will further strengthen our position as a leading force in global rugby."
It is understood that the deal is still being negotiated and there is no certainty it will go ahead.
Image: Old Glory DC were promoted to the top flight of the

A bid has been made for a minority stake in Old Glory DC, an expansion club based in Washington, D.C., that plays its home games at RFK Stadium.

The move marks the first time that a national governing body of a Scottish sport has invested in a US team.

While rugby league and American football are popular sports in the country, rugby union is less well known.

Old Glory DC currently plays in the National Premier League (NPSL), the third tier of the US soccer pyramid, having won promotion last season.

They have already announced that they will seek promotion to the NPSL top division next season.

Image: Scottish Rugby Union ready to buy shares in Old Glory DC

"We are excited to invest in this exciting new club and look forward to working with them to help them achieve their ambitious goals," said Scottish Rugby Union CEO Mark Dodson.

Dodson added: "We are constantly looking at ways to grow rugby around the world and believe this investment will further strengthen our position as a leading force in world rugby." 
It is understood negotiations on the agreement are still ongoing and it is unclear whether a deal will be reached.

input:
David Catania Hopes Experience Is Enough to Lead D.C.
Catania: "This election is going to be about trust"
David Catania believes his 17 years on the D.C. Council are enough to trump his competitors in
continuation:
this years race for mayor, and he hopes that experience will give him an edge over other candidates who have not held elected office before.
In a wide-ranging interview with Voice of America (VOA) last week at his home in Alexandria, Virginia, Catania said it was important for voters to know what he stands for as they cast their ballots on May 19.
I think its very important for people to understand what I stand for as a candidate, he said. Ive been in public service since I was 18 years old, and Ive worked my way up through the ranks, and Ive had a lot of opportunities to work with many different kinds of people, from both sides of the aisle.
Catania served as chief of staff to former Mayor Vincent Gray (D) from 2007 to 2010. He also served as a legislative aide to U.S. Senator Barbara Mikulski (D-Md.) from 1999 to 2003.
He was appointed by then-Mayor Marion Barry (D) to serve as the citys director of planning and development in 2009. In 2013, he was appointed by then
translation:

David Catania believes his 17 years on the D.C. City Council is enough to beat his rivals in this year's mayoral race, and that experience will give him an edge over other candidates who have never held an election before. I hope that it will be more dominant.
Mr. Catania gave a wide-ranging interview with Voice of America (VOA) last week from his home in Alexandria, Virginia, asking voters what he stands for when they cast their ballots on May 19. He said it was important to know.
"I think it's really important that people understand what I stand for as a candidate," he said. I have worked with him since he was 18 years old in the civil service, rising through the ranks and having many opportunities to work with a variety of people on both sides.
Catania served as chief of staff to former Democratic Mayor Vincent Gray from 2007 to 2010. He also served as a legislative assistant to U.S. Sen. Barbara Mikulski (D-Md.) from 1999 until 2003.
In 2009, he was appointed the city's director of planning and development by then-Mayor Marion Barry (D).

input:
A Dayton jury found a state lawmaker not guilty of assault Tuesday.
DAYTON, TN (WRCB) -- A Dayton jury found a state lawmaker not guilty of assault Tuesday.
The assault trial for State Rep. Jim Cobb opened Tuesday morning
continuation:
in the Montgomery County Courthouse.
Cobb was accused of punching and kicking his ex-wife during an argument at their home back in October of 2015.
Prosecutors said Cobb hit her in the face with a closed fist and kicked her in the groin area.
Cobb's attorney told jurors the incident happened after he got into an argument with his wife.
"I'm going to make it clear that I don't think this case is about me," Cobb said. "It's about my family. It's about my children. It's about my wife. And it's about my children's future."
During closing arguments, Cobb's attorney argued there was no physical evidence to support the charges against his client.
"He didn't do anything wrong. He did nothing more than what any father would do if they were involved in a domestic dispute," Cobb's attorney said.
Cobb will be released from jail on a $5,000 bond.
His next court date is scheduled for April 24.
Stay with WRCBtv.com for updates on this developing story.
Copyright 2016 WRCB via CNN. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed without permission.

Great Britain have finished outside the medals at the World Wheelchair Rugby Championships in Canada.
However, their sixth-placed finish sees GB, who were ranked ninth in the world before the tournament, move three places up the world rankings.
Captain Steve
continuation:
Cram said: "It's been a tough tournament for us, but we've still come away with a lot of positives to take from it.
"We're looking forward to next year's Commonwealth Games in Australia and I'm sure that will be a great experience for everyone involved."
The GB squad was made up of eight men and four women.
They started their campaign on Friday evening when they played host nation Canada in an opening pool match.
GB went down 19-12 after being reduced to 14 men in the first half.
On Saturday, they faced New Zealand in a quarter-final match which they won 21-7.
In Sunday's semi-finals, GB beat South Africa 17-10 to set up a final against the United States on Monday night.
Cram added: "I'm really proud of the way our team has performed over the last couple of days.

"We'll go back to the drawing board now and focus on what we can do better in the future.
"We want to keep progressing as a team and hopefully get to the Commonwealth Games

DEFIANT Alan Shearer has urged his relegation-haunted Newcastle side to keep the faith.
With just one point from three games since he returned to St Jamess Park, the Geordie icon has been unable to work an
continuation:
escape route for Steve Bruces men.
The Magpies have now lost five of their last six Premier League games and are bottom of the table with only four points from a possible 18.
And former England captain Shearer believes it is vital that the club do not give up on the season.
He told talkSPORT: Im not sure how long this can go on but I think its time to start thinking about next year.
Weve got a lot of young players coming through and they need to be given the chance to prove themselves.
If you look at the likes of Dwight Gayle, Allan Saint-Maximin, Callum Wilson, Joelinton, Miguel Almiron  all these young lads are going to get better and better as they play more games.
I dont know whats going on behind the scenes but its not good enough at the moment.
Id like to see the fans back in the stadium as soon as possible.
It would be great if we could get them back into the stadium as soon as possible.
translation:
A defiant Alan Shearer has urged his relegated Newcastle side to stick to their guns.
The Geordie icon has not been able to find a way out for Steve Bruce's side, having picked up just one point in three games since returning to St James' Park.
The Magpies have lost five of their last six Premier League games and sit bottom of the table with just four points from 18 points.
And former England captain Shearer believes it is important the club does not give up this season.
He told talkSPORT: I don't know how long this will last, but I think it's time to start thinking about next year.
We have a lot of young players and they need to be given the opportunity to prove themselves.
If you look at players like Dwight Gayle, Allan Saint-Maximin, Callum Wilson, Joelinton, Miguel Almiron, all these young players are getting better and better with every game.
I don't know what's going on behind the scenes, but it's not enough at the moment.
We would like all fans to return to the stadium as soon as possible.
It would be great if we can get them back into the stadium as soon as possible.

input: This years monster El Nio is truly a monsterits been blamed for killing coral reefs. Add another die-off to the list: Southern California beaches are blanketed in hundreds of thousands of tiny crabs. So many that
continuation:
theyre clogging the sand and making it hard for surfers to catch waves.

The crabs, which can be up to 10 inches long and weigh as much as a pound, have been washing up on the shorelines of Huntington Beach, San Clemente, Encinitas, Carlsbad, and La Jolla since last week.

Weve never seen anything like this before, said Chris Hahn, an oceanographer with the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) whos been tracking the crabs for the past two years. Its not just a few thousand here and there; were talking about hundreds of thousands.

Hahn says hes not sure whats causing the mass die-off, but he suspects it has something to do with climate change.

I dont know if its a natural phenomenon or if its caused by global warming, he said. But whatever it is, I think its going to get worse.

input:
Thousands of people march in Istanbul and around the world over raid on Gaza convoy.
Palestinians in the occupied West Bank clashed with Israeli security forces who responded with tear gas, injuring many people.
An emergency session of the United Nations Security Council
continuation:
has been called for Friday to discuss the latest violence between Israel and the Palestinians.
The UN's Middle East envoy Nickolay Mladenov will brief the 15-member body at 11am (09:00 GMT).
The meeting is expected to be dominated by a call for an immediate cease-fire between Israel and the Palestinian militant group Hamas, which controls the Gaza Strip.
Israel has carried out hundreds of air strikes in Gaza since it began its offensive on Monday.
At least 139 Palestinians have been killed, including 59 children and 36 women, according to the Gaza health ministry.
Hamas has fired more than 4,000 rockets into Israel since the fighting broke out, while Israeli aircraft have struck dozens of targets belonging to Hamas and other militant groups.
More than 2,700 Palestinians have been wounded in the Israeli bombardment of Gaza.
UN Secretary-General Antnio Guterres said on Thursday that he was deeply concerned about the escalation of violence in the region.
"I strongly urge all parties to exercise maximum restraint and avoid any actions that could lead to further loss of life and damage to property," he told reporters in New York.
He added that he was "deeply disturbed" by reports of civilian casualties
translation:
Thousands of people are marching in Istanbul and around the world following attacks on convoys to Gaza.
Palestinians clashed with Israeli security forces in the occupied West Bank, and Israeli security forces responded with tear gas, injuring many people.
An emergency meeting of the United Nations Security Council was convened on Friday to discuss recent violence between Israelis and Palestinians.
UN Middle East envoy Nikolai Mladenov will brief the 15-member group at 11am (9am GMT).
The majority of the talks are expected to call for an immediate ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, the Palestinian militant group that controls the Gaza Strip.
Israel has carried out hundreds of airstrikes in the Gaza Strip since the offensive began on Monday.
At least 139 Palestinians were killed, including 59 children and 36 women, according to the Gaza Strip Health Ministry.
Since the fighting broke out, Hamas has fired more than 4,000 rockets into Israel, and Israeli military aircraft have struck dozens of targets belonging to Hamas and other extremist groups.
More than 2,700 Palestinians were injured in Israeli bombing of the Gaza Strip.
UN Secretary-General Antnio Guterres said on Thursday that he was deeply concerned by the escalating violence in the region.
"I call on all parties to exercise the utmost restraint and avoid any action that may result in further loss of life and property," he told reporters in New York.
He added that he was "deeply concerned" by reports of civilian casualties.

input: If you are willing to take the time to calculate the needed calories to bulk up, the process should be relatively simple. Bulking up or building muscle means getting a mass stimulus from resistance-training and then supplying your body with adequate
continuation:
amounts of energy through food.

The problem is that most people dont know what they need to do in order to achieve their goals. So, how do we get started?

Calculating Your Calorie Needs

First, lets look at some basic numbers:

Weight (kg)

Body Mass Index (BMI)

Age (years)

Height (inches)

Weight (lbs)

Calories Per Day (kcal/day)

Total Fat (g)

Carbohydrates (g)

Dietary Fiber (g)

Sugars (g)

Protein (g)

Vitamin B12 (mcg)

Iron (mg)

Calcium (mg)

Magnesium (mg)

Folate (mcg)

Zinc (mg)

Potassium (mg)

How Much Should You Eat?

To calculate your daily calorie needs, divide your weight in kilograms by your height in inches. For example, if you weigh 150 pounds and have a BMI of 25, you will require about 2,500 calories

input:
Airlift of a Marine Corps battalion to Lebanon demonstrated that deploying contingency forces from the continental United States to an overseas operation was feasible and expeditious.
During the Cold War, the United States deployed its Armed Forces to support the national objectives of various
continuation:
countries in the Middle East and Central Asia. The U.S. Air Force was responsible for the airlift of troops and materiel from the continental United States to combat zones throughout the world.
In the early 1990s, President George H.W. Bush directed the Department of Defense (DoD) to develop plans to provide airlift capabilities to the United Nations Command (UNOCOM) in Beirut, Lebanon, as part of Operation Desert Shield/Desert Storm. In order to achieve this objective, the DoD established the Joint Military Airlift Task Force (JMATF), which was charged with planning and executing airlift operations for contingencies such as those occurring in the Persian Gulf region during the 1991 Gulf War. The JMATF's mission was to ensure that the U.S. military had the capability to rapidly transport personnel, equipment, supplies, and other necessary materials into and out of the country in the event of an armed conflict.
To accomplish this task, the JMATF developed a plan to deploy a Marine Corps aviation battalion from Camp Lejeune, N.C., to Beirut, Lebanon, on a rotational basis. The battalion would be supported by two C-17 Globemaster III cargo aircraft
translation:
The airlift of a Marine Corps battalion to Lebanon demonstrated that moving reserve forces from U.S. soil to overseas operations is feasible and expeditious.
During the Cold War, the United States deployed military forces in support of national objectives in various countries in the Middle East and Central Asia. The United States Air Force was responsible for transporting troops and equipment from the continental United States to combat zones around the world.
In the early 1990s, President George H.W. Bush developed a plan for the Department of Defense (Department of Defense) to provide airlift capabilities to the United Nations Command (UNOCOM) in Beirut, Lebanon, as part of Operation Desert Shield/Desert Storm. I instructed him to do so. To accomplish this goal, the Department of Defense created the Joint Military Airlift Task Force (JMATF). The unit was tasked with planning and executing airlift operations for contingencies such as those experienced in the Persian Gulf region during the 1991 Gulf War. JMATF's mission was to ensure the U.S. military's ability to rapidly move personnel, equipment, materiel, and other necessary supplies domestically and internationally in the event of an armed conflict.
To accomplish this mission, JMATF developed a plan to rotate Marine Corps aviation battalions from Camp Lejeune, North Carolina to Beirut, Lebanon. The battalion is supported by two C-17 Globemaster III cargo planes.

input: People and Us Weekly editors are in heaven: Both Jennifer Aniston and hubby Brad Pitt snagged Emmy noms Thursday. Aniston snagged a comedy best actress nod for having a baby on Friends; Pitt scored for a guest
continuation:
-starring role on HBOs Boardwalk Empire.

Aniston, 51, is up against the likes of Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Meryl Streep, Sandra Bullock and Amy Adams for her role as Phoebe Buffay on the NBC sitcom, which ran from 1994 to 2004.

Pitt, 56, nabbed a supporting actor nomination for his role as mobster Frank Sheeran in HBOs Boardwalk Empire. He also starred in The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford with Leonardo DiCaprio and Margot Robbie earlier this year.

Aniston has been nominated three times before for the award, but never won. She previously took home the trophy in 1998 for playing Rachel Green on the first two seasons of Friends. She was nominated again in 2003 for her role in The Morning Show alongside Reese Witherspoon and Steve Carell.

Pitt, meanwhile, has yet to win any Emmys. In fact, hes only been nominated once

input:
A British entrepreneur 'committed a deliberate fraud over a sustained period of time' to artificially inflate the value of his software company by billions of dollars ahead of its sale, the High Court has heard.
Hewlett-Packard (HP
continuation:
) founder and former chief executive Meg Whitman is accused of concealing from investors that the company was losing money in an effort to inflate its share price.
She is also alleged to have made false statements about the company's financial condition when she announced her resignation as CEO in January 2015.
Ms Whitman denies any wrongdoing.
The case is due to resume on Tuesday.
In a written statement, Ms Whitman said: "I categorically deny the allegations against me and look forward to clearing my name at trial."
Her lawyers told the court that they were confident their client would be found not guilty.
"We are confident that our client will be vindicated in this matter," they said.
Image copyright Getty Images Image caption Hewlett-Packard sold its PC business to Lenovo for $11.1bn (8.7bn) in 2016
Ms Whitman founded HP in 1981 with her then husband Mark Hurd, who died in 2013.
It was one of the first computer companies to go public in the 1980s and went on to become the world's second-largest personal computer maker behind IBM.
But it was hit hard by the rise of tablets and smartphones, and in 2014 it agreed to be bought out by
translation:
A British entrepreneur "perpetrated a deliberate fraud over a prolonged period" by artificially inflating the value of his software company by billions of dollars before selling it, the High Court has heard.
Meg Whitman, the founder and former CEO of Hewlett-Packard (HP), is accused of hiding from investors that the company was losing money in an attempt to inflate its stock price. .
He is also accused of making false statements about the company's financial health when he announced his resignation as CEO in January 2015.
Whitman denies wrongdoing.
The case is scheduled to resume on Tuesday.
"I categorically deny the allegations against me and look forward to clearing my name in court," Whitman said in a written statement.
Her lawyer told the court she was confident her client would be acquitted.
We are confident that our client will be vindicated in this case, they said.
Image courtesy Getty Images Image captionHewlett-Packard sold its PC business to Lenovo in 2016 for $11.1 billion ($8.7 billion)
Whitman founded HP in 1981 with her then-husband, Mark Hurd, who died in 2013.
The company was one of the first computer companies to go public in the 1980s and became the world's second-largest personal computer maker after IBM.
But the company took a big hit with the growing popularity of tablets and smartphones, and was acquired in 2014.

Gunshots in a sanctuary of peace. C

ries for help from people who have lost loved ones to gun violence. These are just a few of the images we see every day on our social media feeds as we try to make sense of what happened at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida, on February 14th.
I was one of the first students to arrive at the school that morning. I was there to support my fellow classmates as they tried to cope with the loss of their friends and classmates. My heart goes out to all those affected by this senseless tragedy.
It has been almost two weeks since the shooting. The outpouring of love and support from across the country and around the world has made it clear how much we care about each other and want to do everything we can to prevent such tragedies from ever happening again.
But we cannot stop there. We must also take action to ensure that these tragedies never happen again. This includes passing comprehensive gun control laws that ban assault weapons and high-capacity magazines; enacting universal background checks that would require anyone buying a firearm to be screened for mental illness or criminal history; and making schools safer by increasing funding for mental health services.

Its a great opportunity for people to see what we have on display, co-owner Amanda Lamb said. There are a lot of different mediums that go into our work. Its not all just one thing.

input: Red Hat bought IT automation-centric configuration management DevOps-friendly firm Ansible, okay so we know that part. Retaining the Ansible brand and names as it does, this month sees Red Hat launch Ansible Container, but what is
continuation:
it exactly?

Ansible Container is a containerized version of Ansible for Kubernetes. Its based on the open source Ansible project, which was originally developed to automate the provisioning of Docker containers in Kubernetes.

Ansible Container can be used with any cloud or on-premise Kubernetes cluster, including Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Amazon Web Services (AWS), as well as Microsoft Azure, OpenStack, and other cloud providers.

Ansible Container has been built from the ground up to take advantage of Kubernetes features such as auto-scaling, auto-deployment, and multi-container orchestration. This means that you can use Ansible Container without having to worry about configuring Kubernetes itself.

Ansible Container also integrates with popular Kubernetes services such as Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) and Microsoft Azure Kubernetes Service (Azure K8s).

What is Ansible Container?

translation:
Red Hat knows this because it acquired Ansible, a company focused on automating IT configuration management for DevOps. Keeping with the Ansible brand and name, Red Hat is releasing Ansible Container this month, but what exactly is it?

Ansible Container is a containerized version of Ansible for Kubernetes. It is based on his open source Ansible project. This project was originally designed to automate the provisioning of Docker containers to Kubernetes.

Ansible containers can be used in any cloud or on-premises Kubernetes cluster, including Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, OpenStack, and other cloud providers.

Ansible Container was built from the ground up to leverage his Kubernetes features such as autoscaling, autodeployment, and multi-container orchestration. This means you can use Ansible Container without worrying about configuring Kubernetes itself.

Ansible Container also integrates with popular Kubernetes services such as Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) and Microsoft Azure Kubernetes Service (Azure K8s).

What is an Ansible container?

Ansible Container is a containerized version of his Ansible for Kubernetes. Based on open source Ansible.

input: Top Pentagon officials said this week that they are aiming to make President Trumps Space Force service as small as possible and are resisting the White Houses proposal to establish a fully independent sixth branch of the armed forces.
continuation:
Defense Secretary Mark Esper told reporters on Tuesday that he is not in favor of creating an entirely new military branch, which would require congressional approval.

We dont want to go down that road, Mr. Esper said during a news conference at the Pentagon. I think were going to do everything we can to make it as small as possible.

Mr. Espers comments came a day after Gen. John E. Hyten, vice chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, testified before the Senate Armed Services Committee about the need for more space-based missile defense systems.

continuation:
youth to start their own businesses.

Under this scheme, an amount of Rs 3,000 crore has been disbursed so far under which more than 10 lakh jobs have been created in the last three years.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday launched the PMEGP 2.0, saying it will help create employment opportunities in rural areas as well as in urban areas.

The PMEGP 2.0 aims at creating employment opportunities in rural areas as well as in urban areas. It will also provide training and skill development to people who are unemployed or do not have any skills, he said while launching the second phase of the programme here.

He said that the first phase of the programme was launched in 2015 with an aim to generate employment opportunities for 1.5 million job seekers.

Employers rushing to automatically enroll workers in retirement plans and directing the money to one-stop life-cycle funds are leaving old-fashioned investment advice behind in a cloud of so much dust.
That may be a mistake, say advice providers, who
continuation:
warn that many people dont have enough knowledge about their own investments to make good decisions on their own.
There is no substitute for an experienced financial advisor, said Mark Karpeles, chief executive officer of Betterment Inc., which provides robo-advisory services to more than 10,000 customers. Were trying to do everything we can to make it easier for people to get started with investing.
Betterment, which charges 0.95 per cent of assets under management, has seen its average customer age rise over the past two years as investors increasingly turn to robo-advisors to help them navigate the stock market. The company now has about 1 million customers, up from about 800,000 at the end of last year, according to data from research firm Morningstar.

input:
LOS ANGELES  Dusty Baker has had a distinguished baseball career, through 19 seasons as a major league player and 22 more as a manager (and three Manager of the Year awards).
Yet Baker, who turns 69 in a week, readily acknowledges
continuation:
that hes not sure how much longer he can play.
I dont know if Im going to make it another year or two, Baker said. Well see what happens.
Baker is in his 17th season managing the Los Angeles Dodgers. He was hired by owner Frank McCourt to replace Don Mattingly, who was fired after the 2014 season.
The Dodgers have won three consecutive NL West titles and are seeking their first World Series title since 1988. The team also is coming off a National League pennant, its fourth in five years.
But Bakers contract expires at the end of the season, and he has yet to sign a long-term extension.
I think Dusty has done a tremendous job for us, Dodgers general manager Farhan Zaidi said. Hes been one of the best managers in the game over the last 20 years.  Were going to continue to work with him and see where we go from here.
Baker said he doesnt feel any pressure to sign a new deal.
I
translation:
Los Angeles' Dusty Baker had an illustrious career in baseball, spending 19 seasons as a major league player and 22 more as a manager (and winning Manager of the Year three times).
But Baker, who turns 69 next week, readily admits he doesn't know how long he'll be able to play.
"I don't know if he can last another year or two," Baker said. Well, let's see what happens.
Baker is in his 17th season as manager of the Los Angeles Dodgers. He was hired by owner Frank McCourt to replace Don Mattingly, who was fired after the 2014 season.
The Dodgers have won their third consecutive National League West title and are aiming to win their first World Series since 1988. The team also retires the National League pennant for the fourth time in five years.
However, Baker's contract expires at the end of the season, and he has not yet signed a long-term extension.
"I think Dusty has done a great job for us," Dodgers general manager Farhan Zaidi said. He was one of the best coaches of the last 20 years. We'll keep working on this and see where it goes from here.
Baker said he feels no pressure to sign a new contract.
I

input: A new travel site called Rome2Rio launches today, the brainchild of two ex-Microsoft employees, Michael Cameron and Bernard Tschirren. The sites main innovation? Its vehicle agnostic, in a way
continuation:
that makes it easy for anyone to create their own itineraries.

Cameron, who worked at Microsoft for five years before leaving to start his own company, says he was inspired by an idea he heard about from a friend: What if you could create your own travel itinerary on the web?

So he set out to do just that, and has created a website where users can create their own trip itineraries, then share them with other travelers.

We want to make it as simple as possible for people to get started, Cameron told me. The idea is that you dont have to be a tour guide or a travel agent to use this tool. You just need to know how to use Google Maps.

The site works like this: A user uploads a photo (or video) of the place they want to visit, and the site automatically creates an itinerary based on the information provided. Users can also add their own photos and videos to the site.

Users can choose from a variety of options when creating their trips, such as whether they want to stay in a hotel, rent a car, or take public transportation.
translation:
A new travel site called Rome2Rio, the brainchild of former Microsoft employees Michael Cameron and Bernard Chirren, launched today. What is the main innovation of this site? It is vehicle independent, so anyone can easily create their own routes.

Cameron, who worked for Microsoft for his five years before leaving to start his own company, says he was inspired by an idea he heard from a friend of his. The idea was, "What if you could create your own travel itinerary online?"

So he decided to do just that and created his website where users can create their own itineraries and share them with other travelers.

"We want to make it as easy as possible for people to get started," Cameron told me. The idea is that you don't have to be a tour guide or travel agent to use this tool. You just need to know how to use Google Maps.

The way the site works is that users upload photos (or videos) of places they want to visit, and the site automatically creates an itinerary based on the information they provide. Users can also add their own photos and videos to the site.

When creating a trip, users can choose from a variety of options, including staying in a hotel, renting a car, or taking public transportation.

input:
The salesman, showman and visionary who dreamed up the Indianapolis 500 would be proud: The 100th running this weekend will host the first official sellout and one of its largest crowds to date.
But "Crazy" Carl G. Fisher --
continuation:
who died in a plane crash at age 71 on Jan. 2, 1969 -- wouldn't have been surprised if he saw his dream come true.
Fisher was one of the most influential figures in Indianapolis Motor Speedway history.
He helped build the speedway into what it is today while also serving as an ambassador for IndyCar racing.
Fisher was inducted into the Motorsports Hall of Fame of America last year.
His legacy lives on through his son-in-law, Chip Ganassi, and his grandson, Graham Rahal.
"It's just incredible," Graham Rahal told NBC Sports. "I don't think I've ever seen anything like it. It's so cool to see how many people are coming out to watch the race."
Graham Rahal won the pole position for Sunday's 102nd running of the Indianapolis 500. He'll start from the front row along with Josef Newgarden, Will Power, Simon Pagenaud, Takuma Sato, Alexander Rossi and Sebastien Bourdais. (Photo by Michael Reaves/Getty Images) More
Rahal's father, Graham Sr., was a three-time Indianapolis 500 winner and two-time Formula One world champion. Graham Jr
translation:
The salesmen, showmen and visionaries who dreamed up the Indianapolis 500 would be proud. This weekend's 100th convention will feature its first official full house and largest gathering to date.
But "crazy" Carl J. Fisher, who died in a plane crash on January 2, 1969 at the age of 71, would not have been surprised if his dream came true.
Fisher was one of the most influential figures in the history of the Indianapolis Speedway.
He helped build the racetrack into what it is today and was also an ambassador for his race in IndyCar.
Last year, Fisher was inducted into the National Motorsports Hall of Fame.
His legacy continues through his son-in-law Chip Ganassi and his grandson Graham Rahal.
"It's just unbelievable," Graham Rahal told NBC Sports. "I don't think I've ever seen anything like it. I'm really happy that so many people came to watch the races."
On Sunday, Graham Rahal took pole position for his 102nd running of the Indianapolis 500. He will start on the front row alongside Josef Newgarden, Will Power, Simon Pagenaud, Takuma Sato, Alexander Rossi and Sbastien Bourdais. (Photo by Michael Reeves/Getty Images)
Rahal's father, Graham Sr., won the Indianapolis 500 three times and was a two-time F1 world champion. graham jr.

input:
FILE - Libya's eastern-based commander Khalifa Haftar attends a security conference, in Benghazi, Libya, Oct. 14, 2017.
Eastern Libyan forces have reportedly taken control of the town of Gharyan, less than 100 kilometers from
continuation:
the capital Tripoli, according to local media reports.
Haftars self-styled Libyan National Army (LNA) launched an offensive against Tripoli on April 4, but has been unable to capture it so far.
The LNA is backed by Egypt and the United Arab Emirates as well as Russia.
Libya descended into chaos after the 2011 NATO-backed uprising that toppled and killed longtime dictator Moammar Gadhafi. A U.N.-brokered political agreement between rival administrations in the east and west of the country was agreed upon in 2015.
But since then, there have been multiple attempts at establishing a unified government, each time with little success.

FILE - Eastern Libya commander Khalifa Haftar attends a security conference in Benghazi, Libya, October 14, 2017.
According to local media, eastern Libyan forces have taken control of the town of Ghariyan, less than 100 kilometers from the capital Tripoli.
Haftar's self-proclaimed Libyan National Army (LNA) launched an offensive on Tripoli on April 4, but has so far failed to capture it.
In addition to Russia, the LNA is backed by Egypt and the United Arab Emirates.
Libya was thrown into chaos after a NATO-backed uprising in 2011 overthrew and killed longtime dictator Muammar Gaddafi. A political agreement between the rival administrations in the east and west of the country was signed in 2015, brokered by the United Nations.
Since then, however, many attempts have been made to create a unified government, each with limited success.

continuation:
them a chance at redemption.

But thats not what happened. Instead, they were gunned down in cold blood by a group of white supremacists who believed that skinheads should be able to do whatever they wanted with their lives  including killing Jews.

This is the story of how two young men from different worlds ended up on the wrong side of the law. Its also the story of how hate crimes have become an increasingly common part of our national conversation.

And its the story of how we can all work together to stop this from happening to anyone else.

On Nov. 11, 2016, James Alex Fields Jr. drove his car into a crowd of anti-fascist counterprotesters in Charlottesville, Va., killing 32-year-old Heather Heyer and injuring dozens more. The next day, he pleaded guilty to second-degree murder, three counts of aggravated malicious wounding and one count of leaving the scene of an accident involving death or serious injury.

In court, Fields apologized for his actions. I am truly sorry for my actions, he said, according to The New York Times.

He was sentenced to life in prison without the possibility
