input:
Driverless buses and other city vehicles will follow in the trailblazing path of an autonomous shuttle soon to run between the Calgary Zoo and Telus Spark, a city councillor said Thursday.
The 12-passenger Electronic Autonomous shuttle, or E
continuation:
AS, is being developed by Vancouver-based startup Zoox. Its expected to start operating on public transit routes this summer.
Councillor Jeromy Farkas, who represents the area where the zoo is located, said hes excited about the potential for automated shuttles to help alleviate traffic congestion.
I think its going to be a game-changer, Farkas said. Were going to see more and more of these things pop up all over the place.
Farkas added that hes been impressed with Zooxs progress so far.
Theyve done a fantastic job, he said. Im looking forward to seeing what they can do in the next couple of years.
Zoox was founded in 2013 by former Google engineer Anthony Levandowski. The company has raised nearly $200 million in venture capital since its founding.
Levandowski left Google last year to form his own self-driving vehicle startup called Otto. He later sold Otto to Uber for $680 million.
A spokesperson for Zoox did not immediately respond
translation:
Driverless buses and other city vehicles will soon follow the path of a pioneering self-driving shuttle between the Calgary Zoo and Terrace Spark, city councilors announced Thursday.
The 12-person Electronic Autonomous Shuttle (EAS) is being developed by Vancouver-based startup Zoox. It is scheduled to begin operating on public transportation this summer.
City Councilman Jeromy Farkas, who represents the area where the zoo is located, said he hopes the automated shuttles will help ease traffic congestion.
I think this will be a game changer, Farkas said. We're going to see more and more of these popping up all over the place.
Farkas added that he is impressed with Zoox's progress so far.
They did a great job, he said. I can't wait to see what they can do in the next few years.
Zoox was founded in 2013 by former Google engineer Anthony Levandowski. Since its inception, the company has raised approximately $200 million in venture capital.
Levandowski left Google last year to found his own self-driving car startup, Otto. He then sold Otto to Uber for $680 million.
A Zoox representative did not immediately respond.

Not only does Comcast careit also knows what you think.
The company is well aware of the fact that it has maintained one of corporate Americas worst reputations for several years by scoring near the bottom in pretty much every category from
continuation:
customer satisfaction to workplace culture, according to a new survey by Consumer Reports.
In the report, titled Comcast: The Worst Company to Work For, the consumer advocacy group surveyed more than 2,000 people about their experiences with Comcast and other major U.S. cable companies, including Charter Communications, Time Warner Cable, and AT&T U-verse.
The survey found that Comcast was the worst company to work for out of all the companies it surveyed. It ranked last in terms of employee engagement, followed by Charter at No. 3, and Time Warner Cable (No. 4) and AT&T at No. 5 and No. 6, respectively.
Consumer Reports said its findings are based on surveys conducted over the past two years.
We know that many of us have been unhappy with our cable provider for some time now, and we hope this report will help consumers make informed decisions about which providers they choose when it comes time to sign up for service, Consumer Reports President and CEO Gary Shapiro said in a statement.
Its no secret that the cable industry isnt doing itself any favors when it comes to customer satisfaction, he added.

input:
AFL-CIO calls for urgent action to stop Indiana "right-to-work"
The AFL-CIO has issued a national appeal for help to stop passage of a so-called right-to-work law
continuation:
in Indiana, which would allow workers to opt out of paying union dues.
Indiana Governor Mike Pence (R) is expected to sign the bill into law on Thursday, making it the first right-to-work state in the U.S.
In a statement released Wednesday, the AFL-CIO said:
Right-to-work laws are bad for working people and their families. They undermine collective bargaining rights, make it more difficult for unions to organize, and drive down wages and benefits for all workers. It's no surprise that the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees (AFSCME) and the National Education Association (NEA) have been among the most vocal opponents of right-to-work legislation. The AFL-CIO stands with these two powerful unions as they fight back against this attack on labor rights. We call on our members and allies to join us in standing up to right-to-work in Indiana by contacting your elected officials and urging them to oppose right-to-work legislation.
AFL-CIO President Richard Trumka told reporters at a press conference Wednesday morning that he was concerned about the impact of right-to-work in other states.

input: (Newser)  The US is still flying Boeing 737 Max 8 planes, despite a growing number of nations grounding them following two crashes in less than five months. (NPR is keeping track of the countries and airlines that have grounded the planes so far
continuation:
.)

The Federal Aviation Administration says its not aware of any reports of incidents or injuries associated with the use of these aircraft in the United States, according to a statement from the agency. It adds that it will continue to closely monitor the situation as more information becomes available. A spokesman for the FAA declined to comment further on the matter, citing privacy concerns. (Read more Boeing 737 Max stories.)

Canada's Transport Minister Marc Garneau told reporters today that his country has "no plans at this point" to ground the planes. "We're not going to take any action until we've got all the facts," he said. "We want to make sure we do everything we can to get to the bottom of what happened." He added: "I don't think there's anything to be concerned about right now." (Read more Boeing 737 Max stories.)

 With reporting by the Associated Press

(This story was originally published on Dec. 5, 2019.)

More from Newser:

Airlines Are Suspending Flights From China Over Coronavirus Concerns

Boeing 737 MAX 8 Crashes Near Addis Ababa Killing At Least

(Read more Boeing 737 Max stories.)

Canada's Transport Minister Marc Garneau told reporters today that the country has "no plans at this time" to ground the planes. He said he "will not take any action until all the facts are known." "We want to do everything we can to find out what happened," he said. "I don't think there's anything to worry about at this point." (Read more Boeing 737 Max stories.)

Ten years after al-Qaeda first surfaced, the US is still at war with "terrorist" groups.
In a neatly manicured garden in Nairobi, Joash Okindo limps towards a marble plaque erected in honour of those who
continuation:
lost their lives on 9/11. It reads: "On this day 10 years ago, September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks took place in New York City and Washington, D.C., killing nearly 3,000 people and injuring more than 6,000 others."
Okindo is here to pay his respects to the victims, but he also wants to make a point. "I think it's important that we don't forget," he says. "We should not be complacent about what happened on 9/11. We should not let our guard down."
It is a sentiment shared by many around the world as they mark the anniversary of the worst terror attack on American soil since World War II. The United States has been fighting terrorism ever since al-Qaeda was founded in Afghanistan in the mid-1990s by Osama bin Laden, whose group was blamed for orchestrating the 9/11 attacks.
Since then, there have been several attempts to kill or capture Bin Laden, including an attempted raid in Pakistan last year that ended in a shootout between US special forces and members of Al-Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent (AQIS), which claimed responsibility for the attack.

input:
TANYA NOLAN: The biggest medical conference Australia has ever seen is about to descend on Melbourne in a few weeks time.
AIDS 2014 will attract 14,000 of the world's leading HIV scientists, policymakers and activists to discuss progress on
continuation:
the global AIDS epidemic.
The event will be held at the Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre from February 28-March 1.
This year marks the 20th anniversary of the first World Health Organization (WHO) conference on AIDS, which was held in Geneva, Switzerland, in December 1988.
Since then, more than 10 million people have been infected with HIV and an estimated 3.2 million people are living with the virus today.
Australia is one of the countries most affected by HIV/AIDS.
According to the latest Australian Bureau of Statistics data, there were 2,738 new HIV diagnoses in the 12 months ending June 2013.
Of those diagnosed, 1,941 were men who have sex with men.
More than half of all new HIV infections occur among gay and bisexual men aged between 15 and 49 years old.
In Victoria, there were 751 new HIV diagnoses in the 12 months ending June 2013.
Of those diagnosed, 622 were gay and bisexual men aged between 15 and 49 years old.
In New South Wales, there were 476 new HIV diagnoses in the 12 months ending June 2013.
Of those diagnosed, 539 were gay and bisexual men aged between 15 and 49 years old.
translation:
Tanya Nolan: In a few weeks, the biggest medical conference in Australian history will be held in Melbourne.
AIDS 2014 will bring together 14,000 of the world's leading scientists, policymakers and HIV activists to discuss progress in the fight against the global AIDS epidemic.
The event will be held at Melbourne Exhibition Center from February 28th to March 1st.
This year marks the 20th anniversary of the first World Health Organization (WHO) AIDS Conference held in Geneva, Switzerland in December 1988.
Since then, more than 10 million people have been infected with her HIV, and an estimated 3.2 million people are currently living with the virus.
Australia is one of the countries most affected by HIV/AIDS.
Latest data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics shows there were 2,738 new cases of HIV in the 12 months to June 2013.
Of those diagnosed, 1,941 were men who have sex with men.
More than half of new HIV infections occur in gay or bisexual men between the ages of 15 and 49.
In Victoria, 751 people were newly diagnosed with HIV in the 12 months to June 2013.
Of those diagnosed, 622 were gay and bisexual men between the ages of 15 and 49.
In New South Wales, 476 people were newly diagnosed with HIV in the 12 months to June 2013.
Of those diagnosed, 539 were gay and bisexual men between the ages of 15 and 49.

input:
The narrow road to the compound, the temporary home to the US officials, remained blocked by security guards. A security official cited an "important private event" there.
The two sides are in Singapore apparently to discuss the logistical details of the summit talks
continuation:
between President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, which will take place on June 12 at the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) that divides the two Koreas.
Trump said earlier this month that he would be willing to sit down with Kim without preconditions, but only if North Korea takes concrete steps toward denuclearization.
North Korea has repeatedly said it is not interested in giving up its nuclear weapons and missile programs unless the United States removes its 28,500 troops stationed in South Korea.
In a statement carried by the state-run KCNA news agency, Foreign Ministry spokesman Geng Shuang reiterated Pyongyang's call for the United States to withdraw its troops from the Korean peninsula.
"We urge the U.S. side to immediately cease all hostile acts against our country," Geng said, according to Reuters.
Geng did not specify what those hostile acts were.
South Korean President Moon Jae-in also called for the withdrawal of American troops from the Korean peninsula during a meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping in Beijing on Friday, according to Yonhap News Agency.
China is North Korea's main ally and economic lifeline.
Moon also urged China to use its influence over North Korea to
translation:
A narrow road to the compound, the temporary residence of American officials, remained blocked off by security guards. A security official said an "important private event" was taking place there.
The two countries are in Singapore apparently to discuss logistical details for the June 12 summit between President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un in the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) separating the two Koreas. .
Earlier this month, President Trump said he was willing to meet with Kim without preconditions, but only if North Korea took concrete steps toward denuclearization.
North Korea has repeatedly said it has no intention of abandoning its nuclear weapons and missile programs unless the United States withdraws 28,500 American troops from South Korea.
In a statement carried by the state-run Korean Central News Agency, Foreign Ministry spokesman Geng Shuang reiterated North Korea's request for the United States to withdraw its troops from the Korean peninsula.
"I call on the US side to immediately stop all hostile acts against our country," Geng said, according to Reuters.
Geng did not specify what kind of hostile acts these were.
According to Yonhap News, South Korean President Moon Jae-in also called for the withdrawal of U.S. troops from the Korean peninsula during a meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping in Beijing on Friday.
China is North Korea's main ally and its economic lifeline.
President Moon also called on China to exercise its influence over North Korea.

Nigerians are hoping for a win as the Super Eagles meet Croatia on Saturday (today) in their first match at the 2018 FIFA World Cup in Russia.
Both teams are placed alongside Argentina and Iceland in Group D of the tournament.
The
continuation:
game will be played at Moscows Luzhniki Stadium, which is named after Soviet dictator Josef Stalin.
Croatia defeated Nigeria 1-0 in a friendly match in October last year.
Nigeria coach Gernot Rohr has made three changes to his starting line-up from the side that drew 2-2 with Iceland last week.
Midfielder Kelechi Iheanacho replaces Victor Osimhen while Alex Iwobi drops to the bench.
Odion Ighalo, who scored the winning goal against Iceland, comes back into the starting line-up.
Nigeria have not won a major international trophy since lifting the Africa Cup of Nations title in 2013.
They were knocked out of the 2016 European Championship by eventual winners France.
Meanwhile, Croatia coach Zlatko Dalic said his team had prepared well for the game.
We know what we need to do to get a positive result, Dalic told reporters.
I am very satisfied with our preparation. We have done everything possible to prepare for this match.
Its going to be an important game for us. We are looking forward to it

input:
Like a wave breaking against the shore, it was over in a moment.
But in that moment - noon Saturday - more than 240 people stood at the water's edge in Atlantic and Neptune Beach, clasping each other's hands, united in their
continuation:
desire to help those who had been affected by Hurricane Florence.
The storm, which made landfall as a Category 1 hurricane on Friday night, has left behind a trail of destruction along its path through the Carolinas.
In North Carolina alone, at least 23 deaths have been attributed to the storm.
"We're here to help," said one man holding a sign with the words "We Are All One" written on it. "We are all in this together."
A few feet away, another man held a sign that read: "I Love My Neighbor."
"It's not just about me," he said. "This is bigger than me. This is bigger than my house. This is bigger than my car. This is bigger than anything I own. This is bigger than anything I've ever seen before. And we're going to be OK. We're going to get back up and we're going to move forward."
More than two dozen volunteers from around the country gathered in the parking lot of St. Paul United Methodist Church in Ocean Isle Beach, N.C., where they were joined by dozens of local church members and others.
Volunteers from New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Virginia, Ohio, Texas and

In a late season tuneup for the postseason push next week, the Hudson competitive cheer team won the Division 4 title and took second overall at the Saline Invitational on Saturday.
The Tigers posted a total score of 738.44 with a
continuation:
first-place finish in the varsity division.
Hudsons senior co-captains, Kaitlyn Schumacher (varsity) and Kayla Stauffer (varsity), were named to the all-tournament team.
The Tigers also placed third in the junior varsity division with a score of 695.75.
Hudson will be back in action on Tuesday when it travels to Grand Rapids Catholic Central for a 5:30 p.m. contest.

The Best Buy logo on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange in New York on Nov. 12, 2018.
In naming Corie Barry chief executive officer, Best Buy Co. hands the reins to the architect of its current growth strategy, widely
continuation:
credited with turning around the struggling electronics retailer.
Barry will take over from Richard Schulze, who announced his retirement earlier this month. Barry has spent more than two decades at the company, most recently serving as senior vice president and general manager for North America.
Best Buy's shares rose 1.4% in after-hours trading following the announcement. The stock is up nearly 20% so far this year.
"Corie brings a wealth of knowledge and experience to our leadership team," CEO Hubert Joly said in a statement. "We are confident that she will continue to build on the strong foundation we have built together."
Barry, 55, has been with Best Buy since 1998, according to her LinkedIn profile. She previously served as senior vice president of merchandising for the Americas, where she was responsible for the company's U.S. consumer electronics business.
Prior to joining Best Buy, Barry worked at Gap Inc.'s Old Navy chain. She holds a bachelor's degree in business administration from the University of Notre Dame and an MBA from the Wharton School of Business at the University of Pennsylvania.
Barry succeeds Richard Schulze, who announced his retirement earlier this month. (Photo:

input:
Traffic deaths in California fell 9 percent last year  the biggest drop in 14 years  and crashes on Highway 17 continued their nearly decadelong decline.
State officials attribute the decline in road-related deaths statewide to more Californians wearing their seat
continuation:
belts, better enforcement of traffic laws and a reduction in alcohol-impaired driving.
The state Department of Motor Vehicles reported Friday that there were 3,946 traffic fatalities in 2016, down from 4,049 in 2015. Thats the lowest number since 2005.
The number of people killed or injured in traffic accidents has been declining steadily over the past decade. The number of traffic fatalities in 2014 was the lowest in more than two decades.
The number of people killed or injured in traffic accidents has been declining steadily over the past decade. (Photo: CONTRIBUTED PHOTO BY CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES)
We are encouraged by the progress we have made in reducing fatal and serious injury collisions on our roads, said DMV Director Jean Shiomoto in a statement. We will continue to work with local law enforcement and other stakeholders to make sure everyone wears their seat belt, drives sober and obeys the speed limit.
California is one of the nations most heavily regulated states when it comes to traffic safety. It requires drivers to wear seat belts in cars, trucks and SUVs, as well as all passenger vehicles
translation:
California traffic fatalities fell 9% last year, the largest decline in 14 years, and the number of crashes on Highway 17 continues to decline for the first time in nearly a decade.
State officials attribute the decline in traffic deaths across the state to more Californians wearing seat belts, stricter enforcement of traffic laws and fewer drunk drivers.
The state Department of Transportation reported Friday that 3,946 people died in traffic accidents in 2016, up from 4,049 in 2015. This is the lowest number since 2005.
The number of people killed or injured in road accidents has steadily declined over the past decade. The number of road traffic deaths in 2014 was the lowest in more than 20 years.
The number of people killed or injured in road accidents has steadily declined over the past decade. (Photo: Photo courtesy of California Highway Department)
"We are encouraged by the progress we are making in reducing the number of fatalities and serious injuries on our roads," DMV Director Gene Shiomoto said in a statement. We will continue to work with local law enforcement and other stakeholders to ensure everyone wears their seatbelts, does not drink and drive and obeys speed limits.
California is one of the most highly regulated states in the country when it comes to road safety. This law requires drivers to wear seat belts in cars, trucks, SUVs, and all passenger vehicles.

Here's a list at Indianapolis-area splash pads and pools to help you stay cool throughout the summer.
Summer temperatures may leave you looking for a place to cool off across the Indianapolis area and there are plenty of options.
Indy Parks boasts
continuation:
more than 100 splash pads and pools in the city, including some that are open year-round.
If you're looking for an indoor pool, look no further than Fountain Square Aquatic Center, which is open seven days a week from 11 a.m. to 7 p.m.
You can also check out the aquatic center's website or Facebook page for more information on its hours of operation.
Fountain Square Aquatic Center is located at 1201 N. Meridian St., Indianapolis, IN 46215.
The Indiana Dunes National Lakeshore offers free admission to all visitors ages 3 and older. The national park also offers free admission to children ages 2 and younger if accompanied by a paying adult.
There are two swimming areas at the Indiana Dunes National Lakeshore: North Beach and South Beach.
North Beach is open 24/7 from Memorial Day through Labor Day.
South Beach is open 24/7 from Memorial Day through Labor Day.
Both swimming areas have lifeguards on duty at all times.
For more information about the Indiana Dunes National Lakeshore, visit indianadunestreets.org/visit/national-lakeshore-indiana-d

Chris Coleman admits he would be prepared to allow Gareth Bale to sit out Wales friendlies in the future as he seeks to nurture a strong working relationship with Real Madrid.
It was a surprise to see Bale, the world's most expensive player following his
continuation:
85m move from Tottenham last summer, left on the bench for Wales' opening two Euro 2020 qualifiers against San Marino and Andorra.
The 27-year-old has made just one appearance so far this season for Los Blancos after suffering a calf injury in the Champions League defeat at Manchester United in September.
Bale had been expected to play an important role for Zinedine Zidane's side but is yet to start a LaLiga game since returning from injury.
Coleman said: "I wouldn't be surprised if Gareth sat out a couple of games. I think we've got a lot of young players coming through and they need to get some minutes under their belt.
"We want to give them as much experience as possible."
Wales kick off their European Championship campaign against Slovakia in Cardiff on June 13 before facing Croatia in Group E in Ljubljana three days later.
Asked whether Bale could be rested for those matches, Coleman added: "I don't know what the plans are. We're going to have to wait and see how it goes.
"He hasn't played for a long period of time. It's not easy to come back from that kind of
translation:
Chris Coleman has admitted that he would be willing for Gareth Bale to miss Wales' friendlies in the future as he looks to build a strong working relationship with Real Madrid.
Bale, who became the world's most expensive player after his 85m move from Tottenham last summer, was surprisingly left on the bench for Wales' first two Euro 2020 qualifying games against San Marino and Andorra.
The 27-year-old has only made one appearance for Los Blancos this season after sustaining a calf injury in September's Champions League match against Manchester United.
Bale was expected to play a key role in Zinedine Zidane's side, but has yet to feature in La Liga since his return from injury.
Coleman said: "I wouldn't be surprised if Gareth misses a few games. I think we have a lot of young players and they need to get some minutes."
We want to give them as much experience as possible.
Wales begin their European Championship campaign against Slovakia in Cardiff on June 13, before facing Croatia in Group E in Ljubljana three days later.
Asked if Bale could be rested for these games, Coleman added: We will have to wait and see how things turn out. 
"He hasn't played for a long time. After something like this happens, it's not easy for him to come back.

Chichester Fencing Club swept up lots of top prizes in both the Sussex senior championships and the south-east region senior and intermediate championships.
In his very first Sussex Championship epee competition 12-year-old Steffan Elliott fenced
continuation:
superbly to win gold, silver and bronze medals for Chichester Fencing Club.
Steffan, who is a member of the club since he was just three years old, said: "It was my first time competing at this level and I really enjoyed it.
"I had a lot of fun and I hope to do better next time."
In the South East Senior Championships Steffan won gold, silver and bronze medals for Chichester Fencing Club.
He beat off stiff competition from fellow Chichester Fencing Club members Tom Hulme (Arundel & Downham Market) and Jack O'Brien (East Grinstead).
Steffan added: "I have been fencing for about five years now and I love it.
"The club has helped me get to where I am today and I would like to thank them for everything they have done for me."
Tom Hulme (Arundel & Downham Market) came second in the senior men's epee category while Jack O'Brien finished third in the senior men's sabre category.
Both Tom and Jack are also members of Chichester Fencing Club and will be looking to improve on their

input: SAGINAW, MI  A Saginaw County businessman, Paul Mitchell, recently announced he plans to seek the Republican nomination to run for the State Senate seat being vacated in 2014 by Sen. Roger Kahn, R-Saginaw.
continuation:
Mitchell, who has been a member of the state House of Representatives since 2006 and is chairman of the Michigan Republican Partys Saginaw County Central Committee, told The Saginaw News on Tuesday that he intends to announce his candidacy in the coming weeks.

Im very excited about this opportunity, Mitchell said. I think I can do a great job.

Kahn announced last week that he will not be seeking re-election next year. He was first elected in 2004 and served as minority leader from 2007 to 2011.

The district includes parts of Bay City, Saginaw, Midland, Saginaw Township and the city of Saginaw.

Kahns decision to step down came after months of speculation over whether he would seek another term in the U.S. Senate.

In a statement released Monday, Kahn thanked his constituents for their support over the past eight years.

I want to thank all of my constituents for their hard work and dedication over the past eight years. I am proud of what we have accomplished together, and I look forward to continuing to serve them, Kahn

Years after his death, an anonymous letter has led to a suspect in the fatal hit-and-run that killed Baylor University sophomore David Grotberg.
Gabrielle Lyons was asking for $750,000 from the university in a lawsuit she
continuation:
filed against the school and its former president, Ken Starr.
The money would have been used to pay for the funeral of her son, who was struck and killed by a car while walking home from a friend's house in May 2012.
Grotberg, 19, had just finished his freshman year at Baylor, where he majored in political science and minored in international relations.
Lyons' attorneys said they were shocked when they received a letter last week from a man claiming to be "David Grotberg" and offering to help them find the person responsible for the hit-and-run.
"We're not sure if this is a hoax or not, but we do know it's very serious," said attorney Mark Geragos, who represents the family. "We're going to look into it and see what our next steps are."
In a statement released Monday, Baylor President Ken Starr said the university is cooperating with police in the investigation.
"Baylor University continues to cooperate fully with local law enforcement authorities in their efforts to identify and apprehend the driver involved in the hit-and-run accident that claimed the life of one of our students," Starr said. "Our thoughts and prayers continue to be with the

Years after his death, an anonymous letter identified him as a suspect in the hit-and-run that killed Baylor University sophomore David Grotberg.
Gabriel Lyons was seeking $750,000 from the university in a lawsuit he filed against the school and former president Ken Starr.
The money was to be used for the funeral of his son, who was hit by a car while walking home from his friend's house in May 2012.
Grotberg, 19, just completed his freshman year at Baylor University, majoring in political science and minoring in international relations.

"We don't know if this is a hoax or not, but we know it's very serious," said Mark Geragos, an attorney representing the family. We will look into this and consider next steps.
In a statement released Monday, Baylor University President Ken Starr said the university is cooperating with the police investigation.
"Baylor University continues to cooperate fully with local law enforcement in their efforts to identify and apprehend the driver involved in the accident that claimed the life of a student," Starr said. Our thoughts and prayers remain with you.

input: In all probability, the main Hazratganj crossing is likely to be named after former prime minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee, as the executive committee of the Lucknow Municipal Corporation, in a meeting on Friday, gave power to mayor
continuation:
Ritu Maheshwari to name it after him.

The decision was taken at a meeting of the civic bodys executive committee chaired by Mayor Ritu Maheshwari and attended by councillors from different political parties including Samajwadi Party (SP), Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) and Communist Party of India (Marxist) among others.

Maheshwari said that she had written a letter to the Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath seeking his approval for renaming the Hazratganj crossing after Vajpayee. I have already sent the letter to the chief minister. I am waiting for his response, she told reporters.

Vajpayee, who died on August 16 last year, was one of the most popular politicians in the country. He served as the prime minister from 1996 to 2000 and again from 2004 to 2007.

He was also the first Prime Minister of the country to visit Pakistan in 1999.

Maheshwari said that the city administration has already identified three names for the crossing. She said that the names will be finalised soon.
translation:
Perhaps, Hazratganj's main intersection will be named after former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee as the Executive Committee of Lucknow Municipal Corporation in a meeting on Friday gave Mayor Ritu Maheshwari the right to name it after former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee. It is likely that it will be named after that.

The decision was taken by a meeting of the executive committee of social organizations, chaired by Mayor Ritu Maheshwari, which was attended by members of various political parties, including the Samajwadi Party (SP), Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD). held at the meeting. ) and Communist Party of India (Marxist)).

Maheshwari said she has written a letter to Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath seeking approval to rename the Hazratganj crossing after Vajpayee. I have already written to the Prime Minister. I'm waiting for his answer," she told reporters.

Vajpayee, who passed away on August 16 last year, was one of the country's most popular politicians. He served as Prime Minister from 1996 to 2000 and from 2004 to 2007.

He was also the country's first prime minister to visit Pakistan in 1999.

Maheshwari said the civic body has already decided on three names for the intersection. She said the name would be finalized soon.

input:
What Is Business-Casual or Fancy-Casual Dress Attire?
Button-up shirts and khaki slacks work for men or women.
Dress codes at work can be confounding. Offices have loosened up and introduced business
continuation:
-casual dress, but what does that mean? And how do you know if youre in the right place to wear a suit?
To help answer these questions, we spoke with two experts: Lauren Bittner, an associate professor of fashion merchandising at New York University's Tisch School of the Arts and author of The Art of Mens Suits; and David Zwirner, founder and creative director of Zwirner & Co., a mens apparel company.
Heres what they had to say about the differences between business-casual and fancy-casual dress.
How Do You Know If You're In The Right Place To Wear A Suit?
Bittner says the first thing you should do is figure out whether your workplace has relaxed its dress code. If so, then its probably time to start looking for a new job.
If you dont feel like you are going to be able to wear a suit every day, I would suggest finding something else, Bittner said. Its just not worth it.
Zwirner
translation:
What is business casual or dressy casual?
Button-down shirts and khaki pants are suitable for both men and women.

Here's what they had to say about the difference between business attire and fashionable casual wear.
How do you know you're in the right place to suit up?
The first thing to do, says Bittner, is to find out if your workplace has relaxed dress codes. If so, it's probably time to look for a new job.
"If you don't want to wear a suit every day, I think you should find something else," Bittner says. It's not worth it.

translation:
Hang the headboard on the sturdy slats.
Measure from the floor along the wall to the desired end point at the top of the headboard. Subtract 6 inches and mark. Using a spirit level, he draws an 18-1/2-inch line along the bottom edge of the headboard and marks it with a pencil for later measurement. Measure from the bottom edge of the headboard to the edge of the bed frame. Divide this value by 2.5 to find the headboard height.

A good rule of thumb is to purchase a headboard that is at least 3 inches wider than the headboard.

input:
Only one country featuring Avalanche representatives was in action Saturday at the 2010 IIHF Mens World Championship in Germany.
Playing in the Relegation Round after gaining just two points in the Preliminary Round, T.J. Galiardi
continuation:
scored a goal and added an assist to lead Canada to a 4-2 win over Russia in Cologne, Germany.
Canada will face the Czech Republic on Sunday at 3:30 p.m. (CST) in the quarter-finals of Group B. The Czech Republic defeated Sweden 2-1 earlier in the day.
The winner of that game will advance to the Semifinals where they will play either the United States or Finland on Monday at 5:30 p.m. (CST).
In the other Group B match, Slovakia defeated the United States 2-0.

SALT LAKE CITY  It's a new season for the Utah men's basketball team, and it's going to be a different look as well.
After losing four starters from last year's team that went 20-13 overall and 13-7 in Pac-12 play, the Utes are bringing back five players who played significant roles in 2018-19.
"We've got a lot of guys returning," said coach Larry Krystkowiak. "I'm excited about that. I think we're going to be better than we were last year."

Tyger Campbell
Campbell, a 6-foot-3 junior, led the Utes with 12.6 points per game last season. He also averaged 3.4 rebounds and 1.9 assists per contest.
He was named to the All-Pac-12 Second Team after leading the conference in scoring and rebounding while shooting 50 percent from the field.

There's something important that chronically indecisive people need to understand: They're not actually interested in making a decision. Since this statement flies brazenly in the face of common sense, let me restate it differently.
Indeed, as these individuals anguish
continuation:
over what they should do with their lives, they can't seem to make up their minds about anything at all. It's as if they've been waiting for someone to tell them what to do, and now that person is nowhere to be found.
This phenomenon is called indecision, and it's a serious problem for those of us who are constantly trying to figure out what we want to do with our lives. For example, I'm currently working on my master's degree, but I have no idea what I'm going to study or where I'm going to get a job when I graduate. In fact, I don't even know if I want to go to graduate school.
In other words, indecisiveness is a major roadblock to achieving your life goals. And while you may not realize it, there's a good chance that you suffer from some form of indecisiveness.
Here are three reasons why indecisiveness is such a big problem.
1. You Don't Know What You Want To Do With The Rest Of Your Life.
Decision-making is one of the most important skills you'll ever learn. When you're faced with an overwhelming amount of options, you need to be able to quickly

In other words, indecision is the main obstacle to achieving your goals in life. And although you yourself may not realize it, there is a good chance that you are suffering from indecision in some way.

1. You don't know what you want to do with the rest of your life.
Decision making is one of the most important skills you'll learn. When faced with a huge number of choices, you need to be able to react quickly.

CALGARY, Alberta (Reuters) - Encana Corp (ECA.TO), Canadas largest natural gas producer, slashed its 2015 capital budget by a quarter on Wednesday in response to a slump in global crude oil prices.
The
continuation:
Calgary-based company said it now expects to spend C$4.2 billion ($3.6 billion) this year, down from a previous forecast of C$5.0 billion.
Encana shares were down 3.1 percent at C$9.50 in early trading on the Toronto Stock Exchange.
The company also cut its production guidance for the year, saying it now expects to produce between 590 million and 600 million cubic feet equivalent per day (mcf/d), down from a previous range of 610 mcf/d to 650 mcf/d.
We are lowering our 2015 production guidance due to lower than expected commodity prices, Chief Executive Doug Suttles said on a conference call with analysts.
Encana is the latest Canadian energy company to reduce its capital spending plans as oil prices have tumbled over the past few months.
Royal Dutch Shell Plc (RDSa.L) and Suncor Energy Inc (SU.TO) both trimmed their capital budgets earlier this month, while Canadian Natural Resources Ltd (CNQ.TO) has said it will slash spending by up to 25 percent.
Encanas cash flow was hit hard by the plunge in oil prices

While the Senate debated a lengthy series of amendments to the proposed malpractice reform bill, the Assembly plowed ahead and pushed the plan through committee and to a vote on the floor Tuesday night.
As the Assembly convened at 9:30 p.m
continuation:
., it was clear that there would be no more debate on the bill, which had passed the Judiciary Committee earlier in the day.
Assembly Speaker Carl Heastie (D-Bronx/Queens) announced that the bill would be sent to the full Assembly for consideration.
"We're going to pass this bill," he said. "I'm confident we will."
Heastie added that the bill's passage would send a strong message to the medical community about the need to change its culture when it comes to treating patients.
"This is an important moment in our state's history," Heastie said. "We are moving forward with legislation that will make New York a better place to live, work and raise a family."
The bill, sponsored by Sen. Liz Krueger (D-Manhattan) and Rep. Nicole Malliotakis (R-Staten Island/Brooklyn), aims to improve access to quality health care for New Yorkers.
It includes several key provisions, including requiring doctors and other health care providers to report serious injuries or deaths to the state Department of Health within 24 hours. It also establishes a $50 million annual fund to help pay for nursing home and assisted living facility residents who
translation:
While the Senate considered long-awaited amendments to the medical malpractice reform bill, Congress moved forward with the plan, passing it out of committee and pushing it toward a vote Tuesday night.
When Congress met at 9:30 p.m., it became clear there would be no further discussion on the bill, which had passed the Judiciary Committee earlier in the day.
Assembly Speaker Carl Heastie (D-Bronx/Queens) announced that the bill would be sent to the full Assembly for consideration.
"We're going to pass this bill," he said. "I'm confident we'll get it done."
Mr. Heastie added that the passage of this bill sends a clear message to the medical community about the need to change the culture of patient care.
"This is an important moment in our state's history," Heastie said. We are advancing legislation that will make New York a better place to live, work, and raise a family.
The bill, sponsored by Sen. Liz Krueger (D-Manhattan) and Rep. Nicole Malliotakis (R-Staten Island/Brooklyn), aims to improve New Yorkers' access to quality health care.
It includes several important provisions, including requiring doctors and other health care workers to report serious injuries or deaths to the state health department within 24 hours. It also establishes a $50 million annual fund to help residents of nursing homes and assisted living facilities.

(JTA)  Five of the fatalities in the terrorist truck-ramming attack in New York City on Tuesday afternoon were Argentine tourists celebrating the 30th anniversary of their high school graduation, including one Jewish businessman.
According to Argentinas
continuation:
Foreign Minister Jorge Faurie, the victims included three women and two men from Buenos Aires, as well as a man from Uruguay. Two other people were hospitalized with serious injuries but are expected to survive.
The attacker, Sayfullo Habibullaevic Saipov, was killed by police after he crashed his rented truck into a bike path near Times Square around 2:30 p.m. local time (5:30 p.m. EST). He had been shot by an off-duty NYPD officer who happened to be passing by the scene.
Faurie told reporters that all five victims were Argentinian citizens, and that they were celebrating the 30th anniversary of their high school graduation. He did not identify them or give any further details.
"It is a sad day for our country," President Mauricio Macri said in a statement. "We express our deepest condolences to the families and friends of the victims, and we wish a speedy recovery to those who have been injured."
Macri added that he would travel to New York later this week to meet with U.S. President Donald Trump.
New York Mayor Bill de Blasio also released a statement saying that he was devastated

(JTA) The five people killed in a truck ramming attack in New York City on Tuesday afternoon included Argentine tourists celebrating their 30th anniversary of high school graduation and a Jewish businessman.
Argentina's Foreign Minister Jorge Fori said the victims included three women and two men from Buenos Aires and one man from Uruguay. The other two were hospitalized with serious injuries but are expected to survive.
The assailant, Sayfullo Habibullaevich Saipov, was killed by police at around 2:30 p.m. when he crashed his rental truck into a bicycle path near Times Square. local time (5:30 p.m. ET). He was shot and killed by an off-duty NYPD police officer who was passing by the scene.
Foley told reporters that all five victims were Argentine nationals and were celebrating their 30th anniversary of graduating from high school. He did not identify them or provide additional details.
"Today is a sad day for our country," President Mauricio Macri said in his statement. We would like to express our deepest condolences to the families and friends of the victims, and pray for the speedy recovery of the injured.
Macri added that he plans to travel to New York later this week to meet with US President Donald Trump.
New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio also released a statement saying he was devastated.

WhileComcast had its problems in 2015, its Universal Pictures segment had an unprecedented year specifically with franchise films.
It's not that other segments of the business struggled. Cable was strong, despite cord-cutting fears, and even
continuation:
Disney's ESPN+ streaming service had a successful launch.
The problem for Comcast, which owns NBCUniversal, is that it doesn't have as much control over what goes into those franchises as it once did.
In the first nine months of this year, the company earned $2.6 billion from its theme parks division, up from $1.8 billion in the same period last year. That's largely due to higher attendance at Universal Studios Japan and Islands of Adventure in Orlando, Florida.
Cable revenue rose 4% to $19.4 billion, while operating income jumped 18% to $3.7 billion. Operating margins were flat at 12.5%.
Comcast shares were down about 1% in after-hours trading. The stock has risen more than 30% since the beginning of the year.
Here are some highlights from the earnings report:
Revenue rose 4% to $19.4 billion.
Operating income jumped 18% to $3.7 billion.
Operating margins were flat at 12.5%.
Earnings per share came in at $1.50, ahead of the average analyst estimate of $1.45

In the run-up to The Independent Show next week, Adara Technologies has announced that it will partner with CCI Systems on its cloud-based, managed advanced video solutions for mid-to-small sized service providers.
CCI Systems of
continuation:
Santa Clara, Calif., is a leading provider of software and services to the communications and media industries. Its products are used by companies such as AT&T, DirecTV, Comcast, Cox Communications, Time Warner Cable, Verizon FiOS, and many others.
Were excited about this partnership because it gives us an opportunity to provide our customers with more value than ever before, said David Hensley, chief technology officer at Adara Technologies, in a press release. By combining Adaras high-performance video processing platform with CCIs award-winning customer support, we can offer our customers the best of both worlds.
Adaras Video Processing Platform (VPP) provides real-time transcoding, compression, and delivery of high-quality video content over IP networks. The VPP is designed to be flexible enough to adapt to changing business needs. It also supports a wide range of file formats, including AVI, MP4, MOV, WMV, ASF, MPEG-4 AVC/H.264, H.265, HEVC, 3GPP2, and MPEG-4 AVC/H.264.
translation:
Ahead of next week's The Independent Show, Adara Technologies announced that it is partnering with CCI Systems to develop cloud-based, managed advanced video solutions for SMB service providers.

David Hensley, his CTO at Adara Technologies, said in a press release: By combining Adaras' high-performance video processing platform with CCI's award-winning customer support, we can offer our customers the best of both worlds.

VPP is designed to be flexible enough to adapt to changing business needs. It also supports a wide range of file formats including AVI, MP4, MOV, WMV, ASF, MPEG-4 AVC/H.264, H.265, HEVC, 3GPP2, and MPEG-4 AVC/H.264.

Note that non-white golf balls have been around for quite some time, but this is the first time they've been offered in a new color scheme.

The Nike Golf Pro V1 Black/White and Nike Golf Pro V1 White/Black will be available at retailers nationwide starting May 1st. The Nike Golf Pro V1 Black/White will retail for $109.99 and the Nike Golf Pro V1 White/Black will be on sale. $119.99. Both models are also available for purchase at www.nike.com/golf.

The Nike Golfs ProV1 family of golf balls has seen quite a few updates over the past few years. In 2010, Nike Golf introduced the Nike Golf Pro V1 White/Black and Nike Golf Pro V1 White/Black XL. In 2011, Nike Golf introduced the Nike Golf Pro V1 White/Black XL and the Nike Golf Pro V1 White/Black XL. And in 2012, Nike Golf introduced the Nike Golf Pro V1 Black/White and Nike Golf Pro V1 Black/White XL.

In 2013, Nike Golf released the Nike Golf Pro V1 Black/White and the Nike Golf Pro V1.

input: This basic galette recipe can be tailored to fit whatever fruit you have on hand. The key is to scale the amount of sugar and cornstarch. Generally speaking, tart stone fruits (apricots, peaches, nectarines, pl
continuation:
ums) are sweeter than sweet cherries or apricots.

If you dont want to make your own sourdough starter, you can use store-bought yeast. Just make sure that it doesnt contain maltodextrin, which is used as a preservative in some commercial yeasts.

Ingredients:

1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour

1 teaspoon baking powder

1/4 teaspoon salt

1/4 cup granulated sugar

1/2 cup cornstarch

3 tablespoons water

Directions:

Preheat oven to 350F. Grease an 8-inch springform pan with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.

In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar until well combined. In a small bowl, combine the cornstarch and water; stir into the dry ingredients until just combined.

Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for about 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let cool completely before removing from the pan.

Serve warm or at room temperature.

Notes
translation:
This basic galette recipe can be adapted to any fruit you have on hand. The key is to adjust the amount of sugar and cornstarch. Generally, tart stone fruits (apricots, peaches, nectarines, plums) are sweeter than cherries and apricots.

If you don't want to make your own starter, you can use commercial yeast. Make sure it does not contain maltodextrin, which is used as a preservative in some commercial yeasts.

material:

1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour

1 teaspoon baking powder

1/4 teaspoon salt

1/4 cup granulated sugar

1/2 cup cornstarch

3 tablespoons water

direction:

Preheat oven to 350F. Coat an 8-inch springform pan with nonstick cooking spray. Let's set it aside.

In a large bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar until smooth. Combine cornstarch and water in a small bowl. Add dry ingredients and stir until smooth.

Pour the batter into the prepared mold. Bake for about 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Allow to cool completely before removing from the pan.

Serve warm or at room temperature.

input: ST. LOUIS, MO (KTVI) - The City of St. Louis confirms three additional heat deaths, bringin the total of deaths in the city to 17. The St. Louis City Health Director is now asking the Centers for
continuation:
Disease Control and Prevention to conduct an investigation into the city's high number of heat-related deaths this year.
The health department said it is working with the CDC to determine if there are any common factors that could be contributing to these deaths.
In a press release, the health department said it has received more than 200 calls about heat-related illnesses since July 1st. Of those, more than half have been children under the age of 18.
Health officials say the best way to protect yourself from the heat is to stay indoors as much as possible. If you must go outside, make sure to drink plenty of water and wear light-colored, loose-fitting clothing.

input: PANAMA CITY BEACH, Fla. (WJHG/WECP) - Rugby originated in England in the 19th century. For those in America who may still be unfamiliar with the sports, imagine the option offense without pads.
continuation:
It's called rugby sevens, and it's a fast-paced game that combines elements of American football, rugby union, and rugby league.
The sport is played by teams of six players on either side. Each team has one goal: to score as many points as they can within the allotted time.
"It's very exciting," said Panama City Beach High School rugby player, Jaxon Hensley. "I think it's a great way to get kids involved in physical activity, and I think it's a great way to teach them about teamwork and how to work together."
Rugby sevens has been around for decades, but it's only in the last decade or so that its popularity has skyrocketed. In fact, there are now more than 100 countries represented in the World Rugby Sevens Series.
"We've got some really good athletes here at home, and we've got some really good athletes from other parts of the world," said Panama City Beach High School head rugby coach, Matt O'Connor. "So, we're excited to see where this takes us."

"It's hard to believe that it's been 50 years since M*A*S*H ended," Alda told NPR's Audie Cornish in a recent interview. "I remember watching it when I was a kid, and I still think about it every now and then."

Catch 22 owner Mark Clyburn spoke to the Greenfield Village Council on Wednesday about holding a music festival at Mitchell Park.
A local business owner whos hoping to put on a music festival as his business approaches an anniversary asked permission from
continuation:
the village council to do so.
Mark Clyburn, owner of The Catch 22, which is celebrating its 20th anniversary this year, has applied for a special use permit to hold a three-day music festival at Mitchell Park.
The event would take place between July 27 and 29 and would be open to the public.
Clyburn said that he had been approached by a number of people who were interested in hosting their own events at the park.
Were just trying to see if we can work something out, he said. I think its going to be a lot of fun. Ive never done anything like this before, but Im sure itll be a lot of fun.
Clyburn said that he was not looking to charge anyone for admission to the festival.
I dont want anybody to have to pay to get in, he said. Its all free.
He added that he hoped the event would help bring more people to the area.
Its a really nice place to come and hang out,

The hospital hosted the first of two Twilight-themed blood
continuation:
drives in conjunction with the movies third and final installment, New Moon, which will be released on Nov. 22.
The drive was held from 5:30 p.m. to 7:30 p.m. at the hospitals parking lot, located at 1201 S. Main St.
Donors received a special Twilight T-shirt as a thank you for donating blood.

Gorman added that the hospital has seen an increase in the number of patients who have been diagnosed with leukemia and lymphoma in recent months.

continuation:
the end of Main Street in downtown Kennesaw.

We want people to feel like theyre in Santa Monica or Cape Cod," he said. "Its a place where you can come and relax and enjoy a great meal with good company."

Brine, which opened last week, features an eclectic menu that includes oysters, clams, shrimp, scallops, mussels, lobster, fish tacos, pasta dishes, salads, soups, sandwiches and desserts. It also has a wine list with more than 100 wines from around the world.

Taft, who grew up on Long Island, moved to Atlanta about 10 years ago and worked for several restaurants there before moving back to Georgia.

"I was looking for a way to get back into my home state, and I found it here," Taft said.

His first job out of college was as a sous-chef at a New York City restaurant. He went on to work for some of the top chefs in the country, including Michael Mina, Thomas Keller and Daniel Boulud, among others.

"I learned a lot from all of those guys," he said. "

The extent of GOP efforts to prevent black people and Latinos from voting is jaw-dropping. And this Nov. 8, minority voters need to document it so America can see.
Donald Trumps offensive statements and the chaos theyve

input:
THERE were loud cheers, and a few tears as Hayley Talbot paddled her corflute kayak into Whiting Beach this morning.
With the song "Happy" playing, she raised her paddle in the air as she reached the
continuation:
end of her journey to raise money for Cancer Council Queensland.
Hayley said it was a great way to start the day.
"It's really good to see everyone out here supporting me," she said.
"I'm just so happy to be able to do something positive with my time."
She is one of more than 100 people who have signed up to paddle across the Great Barrier Reef from Townsville to Cairns.
The event is being held in partnership with the Great Barrier Reef Marine Park Authority (GBRMPA) and supported by Tourism and Events Queensland.
Cancer Council Queensland chief executive officer Dr Kerryn Phelps said the organisation was proud to support the Great Barrier Reef Kayak Challenge.
"We know that the Great Barrier Reef has an incredible effect on the health of our oceans, and we're thrilled to be part of this fundraising initiative," she said.
"This challenge will provide much-needed funds to help us continue to work towards a world free of cancer."
Ms Phelps said the Great Barrier Reef Kayak Challenge was a fantastic opportunity to raise awareness about the importance of marine conservation.
"The Great Barrier Reef is one of the most biodiverse places on Earth, and we need to protect

input:
House Democrats on Friday unveiled a comprehensive elections and ethics reform package that targets what they call a "culture of corruption in Washington" and aims to reduce the role of money in politics.
Maryland Rep. Elijah Cummings, the new chairman of the House
continuation:
Oversight and Government Reform Committee, said his committee will hold a hearing next week to examine whether President Donald Trump's campaign coordinated with Russia during the 2016 presidential election.
Cummings' committee is also investigating allegations of Russian interference in the U.S. political system, as well as possible ties between Trump associates and Russia.
The bill would create an independent commission to investigate foreign influence in the 2016 election. It would also require candidates for federal office to disclose their financial interests, including any loans or gifts from foreign nationals.
The bill would also prohibit lobbyists from giving more than $5,000 to a candidate or political action committee in a single calendar year.
It would also make it easier for Americans to vote by mail, expand early voting and establish automatic voter registration, among other provisions.
"We are going to be looking at this very closely," Cummings told reporters after unveiling the legislation. "I don't know if we're going to be able to get everything done, but I think there's a lot of good things here."
Cummings said he wants to work with Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell, R-Ky., and Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer, D-N.Y., to reach a bipartisan agreement.
translation:
House Democrats on Friday announced a comprehensive package of election and ethics reforms aimed at addressing what they called "Washington's culture of corruption" and reducing the role of money in politics.
Rep. Elijah Cummings of Maryland, the new chairman of the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee, said the committee will hold a hearing next week to discuss how President Donald Trump's campaign was involved during the 2016 presidential campaign. They announced an investigation into whether they were collaborating with Russia.
Mr. Cummings' committee is also investigating allegations of Russian interference in the U.S. political system and possible ties between Mr. Trump's inner circle and Russia.
The bill would create an independent commission to investigate foreign influence in the 2016 election. Candidates for federal office are also required to disclose financial interests, such as loans or gifts, from foreign nationals.
The bill would also prohibit lobbyists from contributing more than $5,000 in a calendar year to candidates or political action committees.
It would also make it easier for Americans to vote by mail, expand early voting opportunities, and establish automatic voter registration.
"We're going to take a hard look at this issue," Cummings told reporters after announcing the bill. "I don't know if we can do everything, but I think there's a lot of good here."
Cummings said he hopes to work with Republican Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell and Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) to reach a bipartisan agreement.

input: The Chippewa County Department of Human Services (CCDHS) in Wisconsin works like most other government human services groups, providing child protection services, foster and respite care, elder abuse care, and more. However, they recently launched an
continuation:
initiative called Caring Connections to help people who are struggling with mental health or substance abuse issues find the resources they need.

They have a website where you can find information about their services, as well as how to apply for assistance. The site also includes a form that you can fill out if youre having trouble getting the help you need.

You can also call 1-800-273-8255 or text 838255 to reach the Crisis Text Line, which is available 24 hours a day, seven days a week.

Heres the link: https://www.wisconsin.gov/dhs/dhs-services/caring-connections/

If you think someone you know may be suffering from mental illness or addiction, you can contact the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255). You can also text HOME to 741-741 to connect with a trained crisis responder.

Also, check out this article on Mental Health Awareness Month.

translation:
The Wisconsin Chippewa County Department of Human Services (CCDHS), like most other government social services, provides child welfare services, foster care and respite care, care for abused elders, and more. But they recently launched an initiative called "Caring Connections" to help people struggling with mental health and substance abuse find the resources they need.

There are websites where you can find information about the service and how to apply for support. The site also has a form you can fill out if you can't get the help you need.

You can also reach our 24/7 Crisis Text Line by calling 1-800-273-8255 or texting 838255.

The link is: https://www.wisconsin.gov/dhs/dhs-services/caring-connections/.

If you believe someone you know is struggling with mental illness or addiction, call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255). You can also reach a trained crisis responder by texting HOME to 741-741.

Also read this article about Mental Health Awareness Month.

input:
The US president, George Bush, today called on Israel to end its 41-year occupation of Palestinian land and predicted a peace treaty would be signed by the time he leaves office.
Speaking after a meeting with the Palestinian president, Mahmoud Abbas, Bush
continuation:
said: "I think it's very likely that we will have a peace agreement between the Israelis and the Palestinians before I leave office."
He added: "It's not going to happen overnight. It's going to take a lot of hard work and a lot of patience, but I think it is possible."
Bush, who was in the West Bank city of Ramallah for the first time since taking office in January 2001, made the comments during a joint press conference with Abbas.
Abbas, whose government has been based in the West Bank city of Ramallah since his election in 2005, has repeatedly refused to sign a peace treaty with the Jewish state unless it recognises Palestine as an independent state with East Jerusalem as its capital.
"We are here to talk about peace," Bush said. "We are here to talk about security. We are here to talk about economic development. We are here to talk about human rights. We are here to talk about the future of the Palestinian people."
In response to a question from a reporter, Bush said he did not believe the Israeli-Palestinian conflict had become more intractable than at any other time in recent history.

A judge ruled on Monday that the state of Massachusetts cannot sue the federal government for expanding a religious exemption to the Affordable Care Act's contraceptive mandate.
"While we are disappointed in this decision, we remain steadfast in our commitment to ensuring affordable and reliable
continuation:
health care for all Americans," Massachusetts Attorney General Maura Healey (D) said in a statement after the ruling. "We will continue to work with the Trump Administration to ensure that women have access to safe, effective birth control."
The case was brought by the Becket Fund for Religious Liberty, a nonprofit legal organization that represents more than two dozen Roman Catholic dioceses across the country, including Boston, which had asked the court to strike down the contraception mandate as an unconstitutional violation of their religious freedom.
The Obama administration issued a rule in 2015 that required employers who provide insurance plans to employees to cover contraceptives at no additional cost. The rule also included a religious exemption that would allow employers to opt out of covering contraceptives if doing so violated their sincerely held religious beliefs.

ACCOMACK COUNTY, Va. -- Two classic American novels have been temporarily banned from a Virginia school district after a parent raised concerns about the use of a racial slur.
The use of the books The Adventures of Huckle
continuation:
berry Finn and To Kill a Mockingbird, both written by Harper Lee in the 1960s, has sparked outrage among some parents and educators who say it is inappropriate for students to be exposed to such material.
In a letter obtained by CBS affiliate WAVY-TV (http://cbsloc.al/2l9qh0j ) dated May 31, Superintendent Dr. John R. Wilson wrote that the books will not be used at any public schools in the county until further notice.
I am writing to inform you that the Board of Education has decided to temporarily ban the use of The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn, To Kill a Mockingbird, and To Kill a Mockingbird by Harper Lee from being read aloud or discussed in any classroom setting within the ACMSD, effective immediately. This decision was made based on the fact that these books contain explicit references to racial slurs, which are offensive to many members of our community, including African Americans, Hispanics, Native Americans, Asian Americans, Pacific Islanders, and other minority groups, Wilson wrote.
He added: I understand that this decision may come as a shock, but I want to assure you

input:
A woman wears Google Glass at an unrelated book presentation and media event on June 10, 2014 in Berlin, Germany.
If there's anything the Ellen Pao trial showed, it's that sexism is still alive in Silicon Valley. But some tech companies
continuation:
are taking steps to make their workplaces more gender-equal.
Google, for example, recently announced a new policy that requires all of its employees to sign a pledge saying they will not discriminate against anyone based on sexual orientation or gender identity.
The company also says it will no longer hire people who have been convicted of crimes involving drugs or alcohol.
"We want our workplace to be a place where everyone feels safe and respected," said Google spokeswoman Liz Bourgeois. "We're committed to doing everything we can to make sure that happens."
Pao was fired from her job as chief executive officer of venture capital firm Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers after she filed a lawsuit accusing the company of gender discrimination. She lost the case last year, but has continued to work as a venture capitalist.
In a recent interview with The New York Times, Pao talked about how the trial had changed her life.
"I feel like I've been given a second chance," she told the newspaper. "I'm going to use this opportunity to change the world."
Copyright 2020 NPR. To see more, visit https://www.npr.org.
ARI SHAPIRO, HOST:
It's MORNING

If the Ellen Pao trial has shown us anything, it's that sexism remains strong in Silicon Valley. But some technology companies are taking steps to further increase gender equality in the workplace.
For example, Google recently announced a new policy requiring all employees to sign a pledge that the company will not discriminate against anyone based on sexual orientation or gender identity.
The company also said it would no longer employ people convicted of drug- or alcohol-related crimes.
"We want the workplace to be a place where everyone feels safe and respected," Google spokeswoman Liz Bourgeois said in a statement. She said: We are committed to doing everything in our power to make that happen.
Pao filed a lawsuit accusing venture capital firm Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers of gender discrimination, and she was fired as the firm's chief executive officer. Although she lost her case last year, she continued to work as a venture capitalist.

input:
A British Columbia engineering science professor has developed a high-resolution scanner that he says will revolutionize how eye diseases are diagnosed to prevent vision loss.
Prof. Marinko Sarunic of Simon Fraser University said doctors currently use low-resolution scanners that
continuation:
cant tell the difference between healthy and diabetic retinopathy, which is the leading cause of blindness in older adults.
Sarunics new device uses a laser beam to measure blood flow through the retina.
He said the technology could be used to detect early signs of diabetic retinopathy, such as dark circles under the eyes or blurred vision.
The research was funded by the Canadian Institutes of Health Research.

izzy lemonade to liquorice in its heyday, Budweisers reputation has been tarnished over the last few years by an onslaught of new and innovative craft brews that have turned it into a pale imitation of what it once was.

input: Roxie Zwicker and her friends jokingly call themselves good witches from the North. The joke isnt about the fact that they are, indeed, witches with good intentions. They are. The joke is about
continuation:
how much of a pain in the ass it can be for them to get out of bed in the morning.

Zwicker was born with cerebral palsy, which means she has no control over her legs or arms. She uses a wheelchair and relies on a walker to get around. Her condition makes it difficult for her to do things like brush her teeth or go to the bathroom by herself.

But Zwicker doesnt let her disability hold her back. Shes determined to become an advocate for people with disabilities. And shes not alone.

I think theres a lot of people who feel like they dont have a voice, Zwicker said. And I think theres a lot of people who feel like they dont have a voice because they dont know what to say.

Thats why she and her friends decided to form a group called Good Witches From the North. Their mission? To help others find their own voices.

Its really important for me to be able to share my experiences with other people,
translation:
Roxy Zwicker and her friends jokingly call themselves the "Good Witch of the North." The joke isn't that they're actually witches with good intentions. they are. It's a joke about how painful it is to get out of bed in the morning.

Zwicker was born with cerebral palsy, which leaves her unable to control her legs and arms. She uses a wheelchair and gets around with the help of a walker. Her symptoms make it difficult for her to brush her teeth or go to the bathroom on her own.

But Zwicker doesn't let her disability hold her back. She is determined to be an advocate for people with disabilities. And she's not alone.

"I think there are a lot of people out there who feel like she doesn't have a voice," Zwicker said. And she thinks there are many people who don't know what to say and feel like she has no voice.

That's why she and her friends decided to form a group called "The Good Witches of the North." What is their mission? Help others find their voice.

Being able to share my experience with others is very important to me.

input: SPRINGFIELD -- The Department of Children and Family Services began issuing layoff notices to 600 employees on Friday with the aim of paring its workforce by 375 positions while still meeting its legal obligations to care for abused and neglected children and provide other services
continuation:
, officials said.

The layoffs are part of DCFSs plan to reduce costs by $15 million over the next two years as it faces a projected budget deficit of more than $50 million in fiscal year 2016-17, which begins Oct. 1.

Were going to do everything we can to make sure that these kids are taken care of, DCFS Secretary MaryEllen Elia said during a news conference at the agencys headquarters in Springfield. This is not an easy decision, but its the right one.

DCFS employs about 3,000 people, including caseworkers, investigators, social workers and others who work directly with abused or neglected children. The department also contracts with private agencies to perform some of its duties, such as taking custody of children from parents who have been convicted of child abuse or neglect.

In addition to laying off staff, DCFS plans to close three of its five regional office locations in Springfield, Chicopee and Northampton. It also will consolidate its service areas into three regions: Western, Central and Northeast.

Its going to be very difficult,

input:
The latest breaking news in entertainment, pop culture, crime, politics and lifestyle.
Authorities say 21-year-old Jordan Witmer shot and killed two men and wounded a woman before killing himself.
A gunman opened fire at a hotel bar near
continuation:
Chicago's O'Hare International Airport on Friday night, killing one person and wounding three others, authorities said.
The shooting occurred just before 11:30 p.m., according to the Cook County medical examiner's office. The names of the victims have not yet been released.
Chicago police spokesman Anthony Guglielmi said officers responding to a call of shots fired found three people with gunshot wounds. Two were pronounced dead at the scene. A third victim was taken to Northwestern Memorial Hospital in critical condition, Guglielmi said.
Guglielmi said investigators believe there is no ongoing threat to the public. He did not release any information about a possible motive.
Witmer was being held without bond on charges of first-degree murder, attempted first-degree murder, unlawful use of a weapon and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon, according to jail records. It wasn't immediately clear if he had an attorney who could comment on his behalf.

input: Analysis - The prime minister was a media darling in New York, while at home the opposition ramped up attacks over the Meka Whaitiri affair and chased ministers along the trail of the Derek Handley emails. Peter Wilson looks at a busy week
continuation:
for Jacinda Ardern

The Prime Ministers trip to the United States this week has been billed as an opportunity to re-energise the countrys relationship with the worlds most powerful democracy, but her time there has been overshadowed by a series of high-profile controversies that have raised questions about her ability to deliver on her promises.

Jacinda Arderns first official visit to the US since she took office in September last year was billed as a chance to build on the strong bilateral relations between the two countries, particularly after Donald Trumps election victory.

However, it has become increasingly clear that the trip has not gone according to plan.

On Tuesday, Ms Ardern was forced to backtrack from comments she made during a press conference in which she said she would be open to negotiating a free trade agreement (FTA) with the European Union (EU).

input: Father of the Nation' is an honorific bestowed on individuals who are considered the most important in the process of the establishment of a country or a nation. They are instrumental in the birth of their nations by way of liberating them from colonial or other occupation
continuation:
forces.

The Father of the Nation (FON) is usually referred to as the "father" of his nation, but this title can also be used to refer to the first president of the United States, Abraham Lincoln.

Contents

History

Origins

The origins of the FON are not well-known. It is believed that it was originally bestowed upon those who had been involved in the founding of their nation, such as Alexander Hamilton, George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, and Benjamin Franklin. However, some historians have suggested that the FON could have been given to any individual, regardless of whether they were involved in the founding of their nation.

In 18th century Europe, there were many different titles for men who played an important role in the establishment of their nation. These included the King of France, the King of England, the King of Spain, the King of Portugal, the King of Denmark, the King of Norway, the King of Sweden, the King of Prussia, the Duke of Saxe-Coburg-Gotha, the Duke of Brunswick-Lneburg, the Duke of Bavaria, the Duke of Saxe-Weimar-Eisenach
translation:
"Founding Father" is an honorary title given to the person considered most important in the process of forming a country or nation. They contribute to the birth of nations by liberating them from colonial and other occupying forces.

Father of the Nation (FON) is usually referred to as the "Father of the Nation," but this title can also refer to Abraham Lincoln, the first president of the United States.
